post.title: You remind me of the babe... Happy Labyrinth Day!!
post.summary: [Edited due to an obvious and daft spelling mistook then I just had a bit of a play because it's Labyrinth. And why the hell not?!? Last year I actually saw this terrific film at this wonderful ancient cinema in Leeds - the Hyde Park Picture House, accompanied by my occasional partner in crime and soul sister @Gazpachodragon and loads of other awesome tweeps.Â Overall it was a fantastic experience (and one I look forward to draggingÂ @scampykat too in the future) but the absolute highlight had to be when we blew bubbles over the balcony onto the watchers below during the ballroom dance scene. There were a group of kids overheard to exclaim that it was just like 3D. Just Epic] ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ï»¿ Well, according to twitter it is anyway (the Labyrinth society seems to have the first week in May as the actual date but sod that)!! I love LoveÂ LOVE this film, and its soundtrack, and have waxed lyrical on my love for the Tokyopop comic sequels on t'book blog (link? oh if I must ;) Return to Labyrinth). In fact, I think I'm using the little worm as my bookclubÂ icon on twitter at this very moment!! And I'm not alone.Â Though originally devised as a children's film, the film has become cult viewing for adults, and ever since 1997, there is a masquerade ball held in Hollywood where participants dress up in costumes inspired by the film. *Sigh*, one day Neevil, one day... Spotify Like The Princess Bride, there are certain quotes that have become firmly entrenched in the minds of the fandom. Bear in mind though, that once you start - especially with one of the songs - the diehards are likely to keep going for an hour. At least.Â And the gods help you if you have a karaoke machine... This isn't an exercise for the faint-hearted. It's like The Matrix.Â But with Henson puppets.Â And far more serious.Â Should you wish to fake it, try some of the following on for size: Sarah: Give me the child. Through dangers untold and hardships unnumbered, I have fought my way here to the castle beyond the Goblin City to take back the child that you have stolen. For my will is as strong as yours, my kingdom is as great. You have no power over me. Goblin: That's not it. Where did she learnÂ that rubbish? It doesn't evenÂ start with 'I wish'!Goblin: Shut up.Â Other Goblin: *You* shut upSarah: I wish the goblins would come and take you away ...RIGHT NOWSarah: You really wanted to talk to me, didn't you? Practically broke down the door!Jareth: Well...laugh!Wicked Stepmother: She treats me like a wicked stepmother in a fairy tale, no matter what I say.Ludo: Sarah? Sarah friend!Goblins: Hey...her head don't come off...Â Sarah: That's not fair.Â Jareth You say that so often, I wonder what your basis for comparison is?Worm: 'Ello. Sarah: Did you just say hello. Worm: No I said 'Ello! But that's close enough. Jareth: Turn back now Sarah...before it's too late...Worm: Come inside and meet the missus.Jareth: Nothing? Nothing?! Nothing, tra la la!Tiny guy under stone: Your mothers a fragging aardvark!Hoggle: The cleaners! The Bog of Stench! You sure got his attention. Jareth: Such a pity...Worm: Don't go that way. Don't ever go that way. ...If she'd 'ave kept on goin' down that way, she'd 'ave gone straight to that castle. Jareth: So the Labyrinth's a piece of cake is it? Well, let's see how you deal with this little slice...The Hat: It is so stimulating being your hat!Helping Hands: She chose down! Other helping hands: She chose down? Even more helping hands: She chose down!!! Sarah: Is that wrong? Helping Hands: Too late now!Jareth: I ask for so little. Just fear me, love me, do as I say and I will be your slave. Jareth:You remind me of the babe. Goblins: What babe?Â JarethÂ The babe with the power. Goblins: What power?Â JarethÂ The power of Voodoo. Goblins: Who do?Â JarethÂ You do. Goblins: Do what?Â Jareth:Â you remind me of the babe...Fire Goblins: Don't got no problems. Ain't got no suitcase. Ain't got no clothes to worry about. Ain't got no real estate or jewelry or gold mines to hang me up. Jareth: It's exhausting living up to your expectations of me.Hoggle: Should you need us...(I'm so proud, I managed to avoid all mention of David Bowie's epically tight leggings...*D'oh*)

post.title: Keen Onâ€¦ Jon Miller: Why Content Will Be King Of Tomorrowâ€™s Digital Economy
post.summary: One of the high points of last weekâ€™s DLD Conference in Munich was the Whatâ€™s Next? panel which explored the future of media in the digital age. Buoyantly chaired by DLD host Yossi Vardi, the panel included longtime media exec Jon Miller, whose illustrious career includes stints as Chairman and CEO of AOL and Chief Digital Officer at News Corp. So, I asked Miller when we sat down at DLD, what indeed is next in digital media? Millerâ€™s response was encouraging for content creators in TV, music, and books. Companies that actually produce digital content, he explained, will become more valuable than companies that are simply channels for distributing content. And itâ€™s television, Miller told me, that will become the key â€œbattlegroundâ€ in the war to successfully create models for distributing digital content. Millerâ€™s optimism about the music, TV, newspaper and publishing industries is encouraging. Heâ€™s bullish on the New York Timesâ€™ freemium model, optimistic about new music subscription services like Spotify, and is even hopeful that the publishing industry is finally understanding how digital technology can successfully reinvent the analog book. Which may be why Miller is now setting up his own (still unnamed) investment shop that will take advantage of what he sees as the myriad opportunities in tomorrowâ€™s digital economy.

post.title: Review: Sonos Play: 3, The New Leader In Home Audio
post.summary:
What better way to kick off our first review of the new year than with something from Sonos. Â Under our microscope is the Sonos Play: 3 wireless Hi-Fi speaker. Â Sonos prides themselves on providing a high-quality audio experience as the Play:3 is their second and smaller speaker behind the Play:5 (formerly the ZonePlayer 5).
Not only is the company focusing on superior audio but the availability of it in multiple rooms via Wi-Fi using multiple Sonos speakers.Â Sonos has apps to support Android, iOS, Mac, and PC to cover most consumers. Â We were provided with the Play:3 and the Bridge for a wireless audio setup. Â The Bridge is necessary for you to stream music to multiple Sonos speakers that connect to your router or modem via Ethernet. Â The Play:3 can connect to your router/modem as well. Â The Play:3 launched back in July 2011 and I spent a good two weeks with the portable speaker. Â I will answer the question: does Sonos deserve your $$$ for home audio?
Easy set-up for your Sonos product through the app
Setup/Software
It comes with a simple setup to get you blasting yourÂ favoriteÂ tunes right away. Â To use for your Mac or PC just install the Setup CD to get started. Â For Android and iOS users, just download the Sonos app. Â To connect your Sonos system, your just press down on the Mute +Â Volume Up buttons on the speaker and Connect button on the Bridge. Â After that, you are ready to begin playing some tunes.Â
From this point, you can begin playing music from many options. Â The Sonos Controller app already comes with the Tune In Radio app built-in to listen to your favorite radio stations along with whatever music you have stored natively on your device. Â Sonos plays friendly with damn-near every music service out there, from Spotify to iHeartRadio to Rdio to Sirius XM Radio and more. Â The software allows you to create a Queue to stock pile all of your favorite tunes as well as create alarms. Â The software works with more than one device (smartphone or tablet) to share the same Queue with the same Wi-Fi network. Â Loved using it.
"Lightweight and super-portable, the Play:3 weighs just under 6 lbs."
Design
The Play:3 is equipped with 3 speakers powered by 3 class-D amplifiers, 2 mid-range drivers, 1 tweeter, and a rear-bass radiator inside of a small, portable package. Â Lightweight and super-portable, the Play:3 weighs just under 6 lbs. Â Rubber feet to be placed on any surface without scratching as well as being crafted to play laying flat or standing up. Â And lastly, it is equipped with a wall-mounting socket in case you need to set yours up out of the way. Â
"You won't even notice it doesn't have a sub-woofer inside."
Sound
The Play:3 is an awesome piece of equipment for audio lovers. Â At the volume being half-way, it easily filled my apartment but not overwhelming it. Â The rear-bass radiator listed in the specs may cause some concern for those who love to hear the thumping boom-bap but have no fear. Â You won't even notice it doesn't have a sub-woofer inside. Â The Play:3 is ideal for smaller rooms but can be combined with two Play:3 speakers for a more powerful sound. Â I tested it bumping the sounds of Diddy Dirty Money, Kanye West, Coldplay, Sade, Maxwell, The Weeknd, and some Kendrick Lamar. Â I ended up with extremely pleasant results.
"My ears fell in love with the Sonos sound instantly."
TG 2 Cents
The current climate of technology has the world growing with various Bluetooth & Wi-Fi speakers, Sonos arises through the crowd as a young Bose 2.0. Â The Play:3 is a quality sound solution with zero setbacks. Â I easily gave this a perfect score and is definitely a must-have, home audio solution. Â My ears fell in love with the Sonos sound instantly. Â My wife and I were truly sad to see it go but I'm sure my neighbors won't miss it. Â
To Buy Or Not To Buy
The Play:3 is competitivelyÂ priced at $299, the same as Bose's Bluetooth-powered Sound Link II speaker and is definitely worth your $$$. Â The only way this speaker wouldn't work for you, is if you have spotty Wi-Fi/internet service at home. Â For consumers who entertain guests at home often or just an audiophile, please do notÂ hesitateÂ invest in the Sonos Play:3.

post.title: Sweden on the edge (or very very close)
post.summary: Don't think that my choice to stay in Sweden has been free of argues and disagreements with my parents. Indeed, at the first glance, they did not really understand, especially regarding my education, why I wanted to settle down in Sweden, why I wanted to take all these risks while I got very good opportunities back in France. Indeed, my education (here we speak about the diploma, my intelligence and my culture is an other area... we agree? ok right) is rather ok I would say. I got three masters, finished first in each of my diplomas and even got twice the price of my best thesis for two of my masters... So as you can see, even though I would not claim myself like a clever person, let's just say, that I like school and school likes me. Last September, I went back to France for one month, just in order to see my family and to plan a bit my forthcoming life. Surprisingly and without doing anything in this lapse of time 4 job offers came to me and I have to admit they were quite descent for a start. However, I did not feel any excitements in these offers: no interests, no passion and even worse no challenges. So, while my parents were trying to convince me to stay in France - I am pretty sure they were even close to make a powerpoint or a prezi (geeks...big up!) - I decided to expose them my reasons why I craved to move away from France. Putting aside the aspects upon challenges, passion, interest, love, money and so on... I wanted to reassure them by proving that Sweden is not only a cold country lead by blond (hot and tall humain being) or vikings. Indeed, they were quite surprised to learn that Sweden is actually one of the most innovative country in the world and that the business opportunities are all over, you just need to stay attune and alert (and speak Swedish also, that can give a small hand). For instance, we bet that you did not know that the three-point seat belt, the cardiac pacemaker, HIV tracker, Tetra Pak, Ultrasound, Micro IP, the zipper, black liquor, ball bearing and and and THE FIRST HOUSE ON THE MOON (Not yet, but very soon, I promise) are Swedish. Did you know that guys???? No/Yes, anyway ==> Amazingggggggggggggggggggg! I even told my parents that they shouldn't worry because I will have at least H&MÂ to get dress, IkeaÂ for my furnitures, SpotifyÂ to listen music, and of course SkypeÂ to speak with them. Yes guys, all of them also come from Sweden... Ouffffffffff now I am sure my parents feel more released (hopefully). Bonne nuit folks!

post.title: Gray Matter Reimagined
post.summary: Going forward, I will be using this blog as a place for my colleagues to review new and exciting mobile products. The posts will consist of personalized reviews of new Apps from every OS, new App launches, App news as well as basicÂ mobilityÂ information and current events. I will attempt to keep the information short and to the point. Notice I said attempt. I will also try to offer specific reviews of requested applications all in the hopes we can learn and interact together to ensure we are providing the bestÂ possibleÂ information to our partners. That said...please enjoy my first official post! iOS/Android: Flipboard - Flipboard is a magazine style news and social network reader. The app originated on iOS devices, but has since made its way to Android as well. If you're tired of having your news and social info spread out over aÂ multitudeÂ of Â websites and would rather go to one place to see it all, then this is the app for you. The magazine style that Flipboard uses toÂ differentiateÂ multiple posts and news articles makes for a great user interface. The way in which the app integrates your information also keeps you from losing interest as something new and unread is likely on the next page. Do you have multiple social network feeds? No problem, Flipboard can integrate all of them into one magazine for easy access. It handles all the popular networks, (i.e. facebook, google+, twitter) and allows likes, pluses and retweets directly from the app. I would highly suggest this app for anyone with an Android or iOS device who frequents any news or socialÂ networkingÂ sites. Best of all...its free with no ads. Check out the link and video below... Flipboard for iOS Flipboard for Android Windows Phone 8: Nokia has recentlyÂ unveiledÂ their answer to music services like Spotify and iTunes and its called Nokia Music+. This isnt as much a new app as anÂ extensionÂ of an already fantastic music application available on all Nokia Windows Phone handsets. Yes that includes the Lumia 900 as well. Nokia Music prior to this update is very similar to Pandora and allows for "radio" type listening of music and mixes selected by the user. Music+ however, will allow subscribers unlimited access to this music library as well as downloads, an increase in audio quality and lyrics that can be displayed in a scrollable karaoke style or standardÂ display. The service is thought to have a cost of about $4 per month. There is no information on whether this will be able to be carrier billed as yet. Expect Nokia Music+ in the coming weeks. Nokia Music+

Ara amb l'Spotify tots els grups que creia oblidats els puc escoltar de nou i rememorar vells temps. A veure, vaig a fer una mica de memÃ²ria:Â -Capercaille: grup irlandÃ¨s del que en vaig veure un concert a l'Apolo en companyia d'un company d'universitat que, estranyament, els coneixia. -A-ha: malgrat no els he vist mai en directe, crec que sÃ³n un dels grups que mÃ©s m'han agradat dels 80/90. Si mai tornen a Barcelona, crec que no m'ho pensarÃ© pas. -Dire Straits: un molt bon grup de mÃºsica que vaig descobrir per la mare, i en el que fins i tot vaig anar a un concert a la Monumental i, si no recordo malament, tambÃ© en tinc una foto del Mark Knopfler -cantant- entrant a l'hotel, el MerÃ­dien de les Rambles.Â -U2: em vaig comprar el "The Joshua Tree" i bÃ©, ja no n'he comprat cap mÃ©s. Vaig arribar tard amb ells, m'haguÃ©s agradat conÃ¨ixer-los quan Â van Â treure els seus Ã¨xits "Sunday Bloody Sunday" i "New Year's Day", tot i que aleshores jo no n'haguÃ©s entÃ¨s la vessant polÃ­tica de les canÃ§ons. -Prince: bÃ©, el poso a la llista perquÃ¨ tÃ© una Ãºnica canÃ§Ã³ que m'agrada. I molt. "Purple Rain". Crec que Ã©s una de les millors canÃ§ons que s'han fet mai. PerÃ² m'agrada nomÃ©s la versiÃ³ original, res de directes ni de versions. -The Police: tambÃ© vaig arribar tard tot i que em vaig arribar a comprar alguns discs un cop els vaig descobrir. MÃ©s tard, descobriria l'Sting.Â -Michael Jackson: quina dÃ¨ria em va agafar amb el "Bad", ara que ho recordo! Me'l posava dia sÃ­ dia tambÃ©. PerÃ² no pot superar el "Thriller", mai de la vida. No us vull avorrir amb aquesta llista perÃ² he comenÃ§at i, caram, ara no em podria aturar...Â Doncs desprÃ©s de tot aquest exercici de memÃ²ria, escoltarÃ© l'Spotify. QuÃ¨ escolto? Bufa, ara el ventall Ã©s tan gran que no sÃ© quÃ¨ escollir. M'he decidit: "Souvenir" dels OMD.

post.title: BII MOBILE INSIGHTS: How Facebook Could Dominate The Mobile Phone
post.summary: Mobile InsightsÂ is a daily newsletter fromÂ BI IntelligenceÂ delivered first thing every morning exclusively toÂ BI IntelligenceÂ subscribers.Â Sign up for a free trial of BI Intelligence today. How Facebook Will Kill The Phone As We Know It (GigaOM) Facebook jumped into an already crowded VoIP market with the update of its Messenger app. Robert Gaal, of Karma, believes the companyâ€™s scale ultimately will allow it to kill off the phone. Facebook could offer streamlined interoperability with existing phone networks in a way that a company like Skype, Viber, Whatsapp canâ€™t so easily manage. Further, all the pages you â€œlikeâ€ on Facebook have numbers connected to them, so calling a business is just as simple and at-hand as calling a friend. In the near future then, you will call a business via Facebook on the basis of a friendâ€™s request or a like. No more unwanted calls. No more Yellow Pages. No more looking up a phone number you canâ€™t remember. Just a connection. It's definitely a way to make every phone a Facebook phone. Nokia Enters The Mobile Music Subscription Game (Ars Technica) Nokia announced its Nokia Music+ service, a freemium-style upgrade to its current mobile music offerings with features such as higher quality music files and desktop compatibility. Nokia was quick to note Music+ is an additional experience not a replacement. Those that enjoy Nokia's current free service can continue doing so. Nokia Music+ will debut in the next few weeks and the price is expected to be around $3.99 per month. With a crowded mobile music market, including Spotify, Rdio, Rhapsody, MOG, there's no telling what the demand will be for a pay upgrade to an already niche service. Wonder what Microsoft thinks. Seems like Nokia Music+ will go up against Xbox Music. Smartphones Shake Up The Travel Market (BI Intelligence) Smartphones and fast mobile Internet access have transformed nearly all facets of life, but travel has seen some of the most dramatic changes. In this report, we'll explore the market for mobile travel services, dive into travel-related mobile usage, and look at some of the barriers to growth in the mobile travel space, particularly the high cost of international data roaming. Mobile travel services will account for some $10 billion in transaction value this year. This figure includes worldwide paid app downloads, mobile-mediated bookings, and advertising revenue. Mobile travelers are a particularly attractive audience for brands and advertisers. Online travel booking sites already see one-fifth of their business in some categories coming from mobile. Mobile is particularly strong for last-minute hotel bookings. Carriers in many countries set prohibitive prices on international data roaming. A truly seamless international smartphone economy is still a ways off. Because of its convenience the mobile medium is a perfect complement for rushed and last-minute travel planning. Mobile travelers are an attractive target audience. Huawei Becomes Third-Largest Smartphone Manufacturer (IDC via Slash Gear) I couldn't tell you what their phones look like either. This week many are doing a bit of a double-take on the IDCâ€™s release outlining the fourth quarter mobile device market share breakdown for the end of 2012, with none other than Huawei taking third place. The company has never before cracked the top five smartphone vendors in the world.Â Has Apple Lost Its Cool To Samsung? (WSJ) Samsung is succeeding where other technology companies have tried and failed: closing the coolness gap with Apple. The company has used a combination of engineering prowess, manufacturing heft and marketing savvy to create smartphones that can rival the iPhone in both sales and appeal. Samsung's fourth-quarter profit surged 76 percent to a record high on the strength of smartphone sales. Apple, meanwhile, reignited concerns about demand for its iPhone 5 after reporting flat earnings for the holiday quarter. Samsung's surge in smartphones has caused more than just consumers to switch away from Apple. Some app developers have said they are now focusing more attention on Samsung devices. Samsung's latest efforts seem to be paying off, at least with consumers who aren't so loyal to Apple. Marissa Mayer Sees Future In Personalized, Mobile Web (Bloomberg) Yahoo! Chief Executive Officer Marissa Mayer said the company is working on technology that will personalize content from the Web and deliver it to people on their mobile devices. Usersâ€™ data will make it possible to create a so-called interest graph to show what people have in common, helping create a personalized Internet. Mayer has invested in wireless technology as she attempts to win users and advertising revenue from Facebook and her former employer, Google. Since becoming CEO in July, she has updated Yahooâ€™s Flickr application for photos, acquired mobile app startup Stamped and announced plans to hire engineers with expertise in smartphones and tablets. What Not Being Able To Unlock Your Phone Means To You (TechCrunch) As of last week, you canâ€™t unlock a carrier-subsidized smartphone on your own before the contract associated with it runs out without being in violation of the Digital Millennium Copyright Act. And the penalties arenâ€™t inconsequential. While the number of people who faithfully stick to their multi-year wireless contracts far exceeds the number of people who would unlock their phones and bail, this is a lousy turn of events for all you proponents of phone freedom. Unlocking your phone without your carrierâ€™s explicit approval is now technically verboten. What does it mean for the common smartphone user? Not much. Fujitsu Eyes Enterprise Security With HTML5 App Platform (PC World) Engineers at Fujitsu Laboratories are developing an HTML5-based platform for smartphones designed to keep corporate data secure when accessed from employee-owned handsets. The system, which Fujitsu plans to launch later this year, is one of a number that addresses this increasingly common problem: how to allow workers access to corporate IT systems while avoiding deliberate or inadvertent leaks of data from devices that are not totally under the company's control. Fujitsu's system matches an app on the phone with a cloud-based server that delivers corporate apps such as email, sales databases and customer contacts, as HTML5 applications. The Power Of Mobile (Yesmail via MarketingProfs) A recent study by Yesmail found that even though mobile device owners shop more often, they still prefer the PC for making purchases: 42 percent of mobile device owners use their PC for completing purchases all the time, as opposed to their mobile phones (10 percent) or their tablets (6 percent). Check out the full infographic: Please follow SAI on Twitter and Facebook. Join the conversation about this story Â»

post.title: Jesus Jones - International Bright Young Thing
post.summary: Like the Farm (and EMF, and Pop Will Eat Itself) there's something a little firework-like about Jesus Jones' time in the sunshine, aided in their case by a dual dollop of timeliness, both in the prominence of the house scene infiltrating the mainstream in backing up their 303s with guitars approach and the post-rave sense of a change of power base towards youth culture which was taken as something to grab hold of by those observing the fall of the Cold War and resultant international turmoil and openness. You certainly don't hear them a lot today, that big-shorted, scraggily haired beats sound placed against hard rock guitar sounds having aged badly twice over. Right Here Right Now wasn't actually that big here - it peaked at 31, then after US success was reissued and, er, peaked at 31 - but it's still regarded as their calling card ahead of this bigger UK hit for that sense of reacting immediately to revolution. From the same album this feels like going over similar ground in the cause of promoting what Weller once called a youth explosion though it doesn't address things much clearer than the chorus' "you know for sure that you make the world swing". Do we? YouTube iTunes Spotify Amazon (Doubt)

post.title: Nokia intros Music+ subscription service with unlimited downloads, web listening
post.summary: Most of the bigger streaming music services have both a free tier for casual listeners and a paid level for truly committed music fans. Nokia doesn't want to be the exception to the rule. It's launching Nokia Music+, a paid version of its existing platform. Paying â‚¬4 per month ($4 in the US) gives perks that you'd normally expect from a more expensive alternative like Spotify or Slacker's premium tier: the upgrade ratchets up the audio quality, adds lyrics, allows unlimited skips in Mix Radio and enables as many downloads for offline play as the phone can hold. Aren't you suddenly glad that you picked up a 32GB Lumia 920? Not that you'll always need it to tune in -- Music+ adds web streaming for anything with a suitably capable browser. Nokia hasn't said just which countries beyond the US will get the more advanced service, but it should make a formal debut within the next few weeks. Filed under: Cellphones, Portable Audio/Video, Internet, Mobile, Nokia Comments Source: Conversations by Nokia Source: http://feeds.engadget.com/~r/weblogsinc/engadget/~3/WrqO_Mycdik/ Opie modern family george strait how i met your mother Jordan Pruitt real housewives of new jersey Kanye West sex tape

post.title: PST Musician-in-Residence on Creating Music for "Squirrel"
post.summary: Bonnie Duncan in "Squirrel Stole My Underpants" "NEW YEAR, NEW SHOWS!": Series of new work created by local artists continues with great success! What an EXCITING weekend! After a completely sold out run this past Saturday and Sunday, "Squirrel Stole My Underpants" by Bonnie Duncan is bringing much joy and adventure to audiences young and old. Â The final weekend of performances runs Thursday through Sunday, Jan 31-Feb 3. BUY TICKETS New Year, NEW MUSIC!In addition to Bonnie's unique mash up of theatrical tricks, including dance, physical theatre, and puppetry, local musicians created a brilliant score to help take the audience on an underpants search-party adventure. Â Puppet Showplace Theatre's own musician-in-residence, Brendan Burns is one of the co-composers and performers. Brendan Burns is a guitarist & educator rooted in Somerville, MA.Â Â He released his debut albumÂ TimeStampÂ (recorded live at theÂ Somerville Theatre) in 2012 (available viaÂ BandCamp,Â iTunesÂ &Â Spotify), and is featured inÂ Alexia Prichard'sÂ DocumentaryÂ about the project; as well as theÂ Boston Globe.Â Â Brendan is a regularÂ contributorÂ withÂ SchoolTree,Â Kristen Ford Band,Â Karin Webb,Â Molly ZenobiaÂ & Brendan Burns' Roadhouse. Â He is also aÂ founding member of the music & puppetry troupe:Â Elephant Tango EnsembleÂ (nominated for an IRNE), former director of the house band forÂ Bent Wit CabaretÂ and currently the musician-in-residenceÂ at theÂ Puppet Showplace Theatre.Â Brendan is today's guest blogger, writing about his experience collaborating on this exciting new project. Creating Music for Squirrel Stole My UnderpantsÂ by Guest Blogger:Â Brendan BurnsBonnie Duncan is amazing. Â I've been an admirer of her work and creative brain for years. Â Bonnie Duncan in "Squirrel Stole My Underpants"She first introduced me to "The Squirrel" at a Puppet Incubator meeting at the Puppet Showplace Theatre. Â Her show:Â Squirrel Stole My UnderpantsÂ was still in development, but the idea was amazing and the creator was brilliant. Â Bonnie asked for my help to bring musicians into the project, and we soon discovered it was the perfect opportunity forÂ Tony LevaÂ (upright bass) and I to take on as co-composers. Â For a little over two months, we met every Wednesday morning at the Puppet Showplace Theatre and tried out ideas. Â Sometimes we would work on the entire show, and other times it was just one scene, but all of the time we were laughing & giggling. Â Tony would record our rehearsals so we could listen back to our ideas, and most of the time he captured the three of us giggling uncontrollably at the silliness of what we were creating. Â Here's anÂ audio clipÂ of an early draft ofÂ Sylvie's LamentÂ where we were playing around with the sadness that comes from realizing your favorite underwear has been stolen by a squirrel - you can hear how long were able to keep things seriousâ€¦.Example music sketches for "Squirrel Stole My Underpants"Over time, and with lots of practice, we created the music that fit perfectly for this show. Â As composers, Tony & I are mostly underscoring Bonnie and providing support where she needs it. Â Our job is help illuminate and tie together the fantasy adventure that Bonnie has created.Â Top Left: Brendan Burns, Right: Tony Leva, Bottom Left: Ariel BernsteinEarly in the process, Tony & I realized that we would not be able to perform every show that Bonnie was going to put on, and therefore we strategized a way for her to use recorded versions of us when necessary. Â Using the talents of engineerÂ Ariel Bernstein, we crafted and chaptered a recording of the entire score so that Bonnie could use us on CD, triggering us to the next track when she needed it with a hidden remote. Â Through studying our rehearsal video, we recorded and delivered a flexible soundtrack that could allow for spontaneity and consistency for whenever and wherever Bonnie was performing. Â In the future, we hope to play with Bonnie in every way that we can, but if doesn't work out, we'll be there in spirit - on the recording.Â -Bbhttp://www.brendanburns.com/ Brendan and Tony will perform live music for the 10:30am performance of "Squirrel Stole My Underpants" on Thursday, January 31st!

post.title: A Valentine's Day Special | Styafiya - Pretty Lady EP | February 12, 2013

Styafiya - Pretty Lady EP
Release February 12, 2013 by Locksmith Records
"When I stop believe in love, you
Direct my Heart right back to Love. My PeopleÂ say you a Modern girl came alongÂ a just change my World"
A taste for the Ladies Styafiya mentions in the song "Pretty Lady"
Styafiya feather on the 'My Choice Riddim' back in OctoberÂ with track "Share the Love"
Now with these three alternative Reggae tracks set to release on February 12, 2013 right in time for Valentine's Day (Feb. 14). It will be distributed byÂ Locksmith Records / INgrooves | Fontana. To all the top digital retailers worldwide, including iTunes, Amazon, BeatPort, JunoRecords, Rhapsody, MySpace Music, VerveLife, Zune, MediaNet, Spotify, Nokia, and eMusic, etc. Ladies will appreciate these songs with a passion. Styafiya on this "Pretty Lady EP" speak to the Heart & Soul of all women.Â

post.title: 28/01/2012: Nvidia to create reference devices to sell cheap? Acer on Chromebooks, European Commissions new projects! Plus much, much more!
post.summary: Nvidia to develop reference designs to sell to regional manufacturers? Image Credit: Nvidia.Â Â Nvidia are a company famous for producing GPUs for computers and more recently they've been starting to get their Tegra line of processors into mobile devices. Last year Tegra 3 chipsets ended up in a lot of tablets and a couple of phones, but if a rumour from Mobile Reviewâ€™s Eldar Murtazin, is to be believed then Nvidia has grander plans for this year, it could conceivably offer the company a huge boost in market presence.Â Â Â The logical assumption here would be to expect Nvidia to produce their own range of phones and tablets, just like they have chosen to do with Project Shield. Instead, the rumours run that Nvidia will create reference designs and then see if contract manufacturers would be interested in manufacturing devices to sell within their own brand lineup. Â Â The main target here is obviously smaller players who target their own localities. Companies such as Think Fly and Wexler from Russia and Micromax and Lava from India are the sort of companies which could be expected to buy into a deal like this, if it comes to fruition. Â Â Naturally, if Nvidia can design and manufacturer the products then they can all but guarantee a good user experience and ensure that the device is of a good quality. Regional brands will give Nvidia the economies of scale that they need to make a venture like this viable. Â Â If the rumours turn out to be correct then we can expect to see this become a reality towards to end of Q2 this year and we can expect to see lots of inexpensive but good quality tablets popping up soon after! To be honest we'd love to see something like this, we'd buy one as long as they're cheap and we know what we can expect from them! Via UnwiredView. Acer sales suggest Chrome laptops are here to stay! Â Â Acer President, Jim Wong, recently revealed, in an interview with Bloomberg, that Chrome-based laptops are here to stay! It also seems that Google's marketing push on the simplicity of the operating system may have had a bit of an impact on sales too. Â Â Mr Wong announced that his company sales in America consist of somewhere between 5 and 10 percent of Acerâ€™s U.S. sales have been Chromebooks since they were unleashed in November! Because the sales are looking 'sustainable' if they stay around that figure, the company is looking at offering their Chromebooks in a wider variety of developed markets! Â Â Unfortunately though, Acer is still not completely happy with Windows 8. Wong said; Â "Windows 8 itself is still not successful.. The whole market didnâ€™t come back to growth after the Windows 8 launch, thatâ€™s a simple way to judge if it is successful or not."Â Â This is probably down to the 28 percent drop in Q4 shipments from the same time last year. Â Â If you're interested in picking up a Chromebook then you can get the Acer one pictured above here! BloombergÂ Via TheVerge. In other news: The European Commission has announce a $2.5 billion project! That huge budget will be split between the "Human Brain Project" and research into using Graphene as a replacement for silicon. The Human Brain Project aims to create a detailed map of the human brain! Hopefully this will give people an insight into how mental illnesses work and ways to enhance Â treatments. The Graphene research will focus on using the substance to partly or completely replace silicon in semiconductors. Via TheVerge.China is reportedly reviewing their ban on video games consoles! Naturally this send shares upwards; Nintendo's jumped up 3.5% and Sony's were up 8%! China Daily only said that they had an 'unnamed source' from China's Ministry of Culture who explained:Â â€œWe are reviewing the policy and have conducted some surveys and held discussions with other ministries on the possibility of opening up the game console market... However, since the ban was issued by seven ministries more than a decade ago, we will need approval from all parties to lift it.â€ Via Reuters. Â ZTE has announced their new V81 Android tablet. It's an 8â€³ device that will offer a 1,024Ã—768p resolution screen, a dual-core 1.4 GHz processor, 1 GB of RAM, 4 GB of built-internal storage, a microSD card slot, as well as 0.3 and 2 MP cameras on the front and rear respectively. You'll also get the added benefits of 21 Mbps HSPA data connections, Wi-Fi, Bluetooth, GPS, HDMI out, and a 3,700 mAh battery! The whole thing is running Android 4.1 and we're not sure if or when it'll be coming to anywhere outside of China. Via UnwiredView.iOS 6.1 is rolling out at the moment! Check your device for updates!Forbes posted a report from a UK-based research firm who showed off the 'active users' for all the social networks. Apparently Google+ has a higher percentage of active users that Twitter, YouTube and is only just behind Facebook. These sort of stats are normally very unreliable, but it's interesting nonetheless! Via Forbes.Ubuntu's new smartphone based operating system will reportedly not be launching with an app store! The storefront will arrive at some point in the future, but Canonical hopes to target basic users initially and then add support for the extra goodies later on. We're not sure that this is necessarily a bad thing, but it definitely removes it from the realm of a mass appeal, if only initially! Via Engadget.There have been rumours of a 128GB iPad coming if or when Apple refresh the iPad line-up in March! Would you be interested in this sort of storage option, even if it'll cost you $300 more than the 16GB versions! Via 9to5mac.Nokia have showed off their new Music+ service today. The new offering essentially goes toe-to-toe with Spotify. Interestingly, you'll have the option to download entire playlists for your offline audio pleasure, but you are limited to 'four mixes', which essentially means four playlists. There's a host of other perks too which you can check out on Nokia's official blog! If you're interested then the service will cost you â‚¬3.99 a month and we expect you can exchange that Euro sign for a Â£ or $ sign depending on where you live, but that's not confirmed yet! Via CNet.Microsoft's Surface Pro will come with 128GB of built in storage if you opt for the more expensive model, but according to reports from today a whopping 45GB of that will be taken up by the OS! This will leave you with 83GB left for you files. More concerning is that if this is correct then the 64GB model will only have 19GB free when you receive it! Via T3.RIM is preparing to drop the minimum price of applications in their app stores as BB10 launch date nears!Â The Canadians have confirmed that the lowest pricing tier in the UK will drop from Â£1 to 75p and changes to the costs in Euros will vary from country to country, but in France the lowest tier is now .99 euros, but that will end up at .89 euros when the changes are implemented! Hurray cheap(er) apps! Via CNet. And finally, tomorrow (Jan. 29th) is the day that Office 365 and Office 2013 will be arriving! The tweet and picture below confirm you can get both tomorrow! Will it be worth upgrading from Office 2007 or 2010, probably not, but we'll see! Via ZDNet.More time to create the things you want. Coming to @bryantparknyc on 1/29#Timeto365 twitter.com/Office/status/â€¦ â€” Office (@Office) January 26, 2013

post.title: This dopamine is no joke man!
post.summary:
Every so often Iâ€™ll write a bit of nonsense without thinking too hard about what Iâ€™m saying, often pulling stuff out of the deep dark recesses of my brain, stuff that ended up there through the most dubious of processes, like watching news, or reading a book I picked up, just because I was idle and looking to kill a couple of hours.Â Thatâ€™s how I first learnt about dopamine, in a peculiar Rom Com called...wait for it...Dopamine.Â Because the human memory is a fickle creature, I canâ€™t remember what the point to the movie was, but I remember the random chemical term thrown in, and the flimsy storyline built around it.Â
Shock on me when Iâ€™m reading this article last night, What Turns You On? 10 Fascinating Facts About Sexual Attraction, and I find out that what I was using as a convenient excuse for foolish behaviour is actually the real deal.Â In exploring the link between music and getting it on, â€œresearchers at McGill University in Toronto did PET scans and MRIs on eight participants, age 19-24, while they were listening to self-chosen â€œchill-inducingâ€ music, and found that while dopamine was present in the brain during the music it spiked up to 9% around the â€œchillingâ€ passages.â€ Â I know, 9% doesnâ€™t really seem too impressive, but consider this, Â â€œIn fact, inÂ a study commissioned by SpotifyÂ on 18- to 91-year-olds in the UK on the relationship between music and romance, 40% said the background music would be a more likely turn-on than their partnerâ€™s touch.â€Â Folks, its official, this dopamine story is the real deal.Â Or not?
Â Because Iâ€™m quite idle, I set out to do what I initially thought would be light reading, to try and figure out what exactly this chemical is, and more importantly, how to get synthesise the damn thing so I could make some money off it.Â You know what they say about best laid plans?Â Two hours later I was even more confused and suffering a mild stress headache because I donâ€™t have my specs on (long story, donâ€™t ask).Â Nkt!Â Light reading my ass...Â On the off chance you get possessed to read up, do NOT go to the Wikipedia page, not unless you have a degree in medicine, or are looking to fall asleep in under a minute.Â â€œDopamine (abbreviated as DA[1]), a simple organic chemical in the catecholamine family, is a monoamine neurotransmitter, which has a number of important physiological roles in the bodies of animals.â€ Thatâ€™s the first line.Â Good, no?Â No.Â As always, when stuck I turn to the urban dictionary, to read what other clueless people think, and it didnâ€™t disappoint: â€œIt's a catecholamine neurotransmitter, which means it sends a message in your brain to tell you that you think that girl you're looking at is fitter to make offspring with than any other dame.â€Â Even better, no?Â No.Â Do you now see what Iâ€™ve been dealing with?Â
Simply, and possibly erroneously, put, dopamine is one of the chemicals responsible for transmitting signals between nerve cells (neurons), kind of like a messenger. Â Now the way they tell it, dopamine is responsible for everything from motor function to long term planning to personality, and yes, to addiction; again from Wikipedia , â€œDopamine has many functions in the brain, including important roles in behaviour and cognition, voluntary movement, motivation, punishment and reward, inhibition of prolactin production (involved in lactation and sexual gratification), sleep, dreaming, mood, attention, working memory, and learning.â€Â Iâ€™ll steer clear of how exactly it does all these things, because, in truth, I still donâ€™t get it.Â As much as the relationship between dopamine and personality is fascinating (I told you Iâ€™m idle), thatâ€™s beyond the scope of todayâ€™s post, that and the fact that I suspect youâ€™d lynch me if I subjected you to it.Â Because Iâ€™m not a scientist, and because I have somewhat deviant tendencies (as do you, no?), Iâ€™ll restrict myself to dopamine and love, or sex, and summarise.Â
Dopamine is called the learning and reward chemical, released under positive stimuli, and negative apparently, although thatâ€™s still up for discussion (What is dopamine?).Â What happens is this, and if thereâ€™s any scientist out there, please correct me if Iâ€™m talking shit, dopamine is released when you have a rewarding experience, and then itâ€™s released again when you see the cue for that same experience, because the body wants more rewards i.e. pleasure.Â Hence, learning and rewards.Â Problem is this only works with unexpected rewards, once the body gets used to it, less dopamine is released.Â Yaani, for those of you staring at the screen with glazed eyes right now, that shit donâ€™t last forever.Â From what Iâ€™ve read, whenever we experience something new, something unexpected that we enjoy, our brain doses us with a hit of dopamine, branding the experience as something good that we would like to repeat.Â The more unexpected it is, the bigger the hit, which is why as we get more and more of said experience, that is, as it becomes less unexpected and more regular, the hits gets smaller.Â If you think as dopamine as the mindâ€™s way of kicking the body into high gear, to search for the reward, then once the reward becomes easier to obtain, guaranteed so to speak, the body no longer needs to work as hard to get it, and thus no need for the kick start.Â Can you see where Iâ€™m going with this?Â
What?Â You didnâ€™t really think Iâ€™d waste a beautiful sunny afternoon on scientific exploration, just?Â What the hell do I look like, a nerd?Â Please donâ€™t answer that...
This thing called dopamine is the reason youâ€™re attracted to, and persist in chasing, the unattainable, and why once you get it, you no longer want it any more.Â Say, for example, you meet a disturbingly hot dude, a man who delights in being unavailable, and completely unsuitable to boot.Â You chase said man, or let him chase you, reluctant to be caught, but ever so curious to find out what the catching will be like.Â And as tends to happen, the day comes along when it all falls together, and before you know it, the reward has been sampled.Â And you like it!Â And then he buggers off, such as that type tends to, and youâ€™re left craving another fix.Â Ten months later he reappears, and you instantly go into overdrive, you get another hit.Â You know you really shouldnâ€™t, but dammit if it doesnâ€™t feel like the best youâ€™ve ever had, at that moment at least.Â This time he sticks around, and before you know it, he becomes a regular occurrence in your life, only now, the hit is not as intense, and the high is not nearly as high as it used to be.Â In time, the man who seemed to be the best thing since sliced bread now looks, and tastes, like Supa Loaf, worse still, the fake one.Â Dopamine is the reason we keep falling for bad boys, and why it never lasts, it's a brain defect.Â
That makes you feel better, no?Â No?Â Ah well...
On the up side, dopamine is also the reason the spark goes out of your relationship, eventually.Â Yes, I said upside, si you give me a chance to explain?Â Impatient buggers...Â Â Â Itâ€™s inevitable, see, for as long as you keep getting the rewards you seek, be it love or sex, in time it loses its appeal, and you start craving a new high, which is why the Maker had the good sense to throw in another chemical, oxytocin.Â Sorry, I couldnâ€™t help it, but you had to know I was going to throw in another one.Â This science story is a slippery slope, no?Â Oxytocin is the bonding chemical in your brain, itâ€™s what keeps us from hopping from partner to partner at random, like junkies chasing the ever elusive high.Â When you get intimate with someone, physically and emotionally, your brain secretes this little beauty, in part, I suspect, to mitigate for the drop in dopamine.Â Put differently, if not for the bond you feel for the former dopamine inducer, you would have buggered off long ago, in search of that new high.Â And if this â€˜cuddleâ€™ chemical doesnâ€™t kick in, then what?Â Then perhaps you might want to consider walking away, think of it as your mindâ€™s way of telling your body to keeping looking.Â It sounds harsh, but sometimes thereâ€™s no point fighting nature, no?Â
The point to all this?Â I have more time on my hands than I know what to do with.Â The other point to this? Â So do you, clearly, youâ€™ve just sat through 1400 words on a random chemical in your brain.Â And the real point to this?Â At the end of the day, irrational longing and constantly chasing what you donâ€™t, or canâ€™t, or maybe shouldnâ€™t have, is simply a factor of biology, itâ€™s your body doing what your mind tells it to, without question.Â Thatâ€™s just how we do, no?Â The trick, however, is not to get too wrapped up in the temporary high, instead realising that it will fade, and when it does you can only hope to have a bond worth talking about to fall back on.Â Perhaps instead of chasing that truly, madly, deeply feeling infatuation junkies like myself seem to be hooked on, perhaps we need to start looking beyond the explosive beginnings and focus on the seeminglyÂ â€˜boringâ€™Â ever after.Â Seems to me that dopamine isnâ€™t much to talk about in comparison to oxytocin, because what can be better than a genuine bond, except perhaps... I canâ€™t think of anything, can you?
Langa bastards and philanderers, serial monogamists, commitment phobes and perpetual singletons, we all have one thing in common, a weakness (or is it fondness?) for dopamine and a (some might say troubling?) immunity to oxytocin.Â The good news is, however, that there's hope for us, all it takes is a bit of research (and perhaps a lot of restraint), and maybe we can train our minds to respond to meaningful rewards, instead of our usual nonsense highs. Â Put differently, stop stressing and cut yourself some slack, weâ€™re all a little fucked up, literally, best we can do is learn from the past and keep moving forward, no?

post.title: The Mayans Were Wrong!
post.summary: Here we are headlong into the year 2013! Not only is it a new year for new beginnings, but itâ€™s also a reprieve from the apocalypse that many say was predicted by the Mayans. Hooray! Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â STONE SOUL FOUNDATION has got many things in the works as I wright this letter. First of all I must remind you that our Feb 2nd show in support of SPACEHOG is fast approaching! The show is at Moniraes in Pennellville, Ny. Tickets are $12 in advance and $15 at the door. The doors open @ 7pm and the show starts at 8:30pm. We still have advance tickets available and you can purchase them from our website, www.stonesoulfoundation.com, via PayPal. You can also message us on our Facebook page to arrange a purchase. Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â We have also advanced to the final round of Tara's Stand Against Suicide Battle of the bands. That performance will be at the SEC Arena on Onondaga Community College campus. It is on April the 20th ;). We have a chance to win cash, studio time, photos, or a video. The way they tally the votes are through $1 donations ($1=1 vote). You can submit your $1 vote as often as you like. There are two ways of submitting your vote. You can submit your dollar/s vote/s anytime and as much as you like as an absentee voter now through April 20th. And/or attend the performance on said date and vote there. It's for a great cause, help toward suicide prevention! You can vote and get more info using the following link, www.sasevents.org/btob. Your vote/s will make a difference and be greatly appreciated. Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â This is what we have in the works, a new song to be professionally produced, and a conceptually designed music video, a new logo and a newly designed website! We are making these things happen right Now! Expect these products very soon. We are also pitching ourselves to some high end music festivals around the country and outside of the country. We're writing new material at a very consistent level. Our thought is to keep going into the studio and release singles so we can provide you with fresh and exciting songs as frequently as possible. Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â Â With that said, none of this is possible without YOU, the fan! When you come to our shows, buy our music and merchandise (did I mention new merchandise is coming soon) and visit our Facebook, Reverb Nation and Website pages, you enable us to carry on and create! Thank You!!! If you have any friends who might not be familiar with STONE SOUL FOUNDATION, please encourage them to listen to our music via iTunes, Spotify, our website, YouTube and like us on our Facebook page. Wouldn't it be great to directly help propel our band to where we know we belong...on the world stage!!! Thank you so much! We wish you all the best in the New Year.

post.title: NOUVEL ALBUM DE BIFFY CLYRO : "OPPOSITES"
post.summary: Aujourd'hui sort le 6e album du groupe Biffy Clyro, nos oreilles sont donc trÃ¨s occupÃ©es Ã le dÃ©cortiquer. Il se prÃ©sente en 2 CDs, et la premiÃ¨re impression est que le premier CD serait plus soft, et le deuxieme plus hard et punchy, plus Biffy en fait, ce qui nous rapelle les albums prÃ©cÃ©dents. Grosse claque rythmique comme d'habitude ! On publiera sans aucun doute un des titres d'Opposites dans les semaines qui viennent donc restez branchÃ©s. En attendant il est disponible sur Spotify et sur Deezer.

Musical inspiration Inspiration can come from anywhere. Â You can look for it, but sometimes you donâ€™t even have to. Today I was listening to the radio in my kitchen. Â Pretty insignificant you might say. Â But I was listening to a different station to my norm - one of my housemates had left my radio tuned to BBC 6 Music. Â It was Lauren Laverneâ€™s show and Tim Burgess from The Charlatans was showcasing some new material, performing live in the studio. Â It was an eye opener (or ear opener if you will) and I realised I should probably think about broadening my mind and listening to something other than Nick Grimshaw on Radio 1. Â So I started thinking about the different ways in which we discover music. Have you ever heard a song on an advert, looked it up on Google, then downloaded it? Â Legally of course. Â It can be an advert for anything from shower gel, to an ipad, or a tv programme. Â You may remember a Channel 4 ad a few years ago for a new teenage drama called Skins, in which the cast were partying to Standing In The Way Of Control by The Gossip. Iâ€™m not saying youâ€™ll only have heard of The Gossip because their track was used to advertise Skins, but it must have helped filter their music through to an audience who may not have heard it otherwise. Â And speaking of tv, music sets the mood in a lot of programmes. Â I watch Made In Chelsea and this is where I first heard a band called King Charles, as well as M83 who sing the current theme tune, and Iâ€™m not ashamed to say it! If you spend your time out in town getting drunk with friends the chances are youâ€™ll be dancing at some point during the night. Â Throughout my second and third year at uni every Friday night I could be found at indie club night Ramshakle at the Bristol Academy. Â One particular night I remember hearing a song, it stopped me dead in my tracks, and I had to know what it was. Â I ran to the stage to catch the djâ€™s attention and was told it was a band called The Killers, and the song was Mr Brightside. Â This was before I had Spotify, Youtube or Myspace, and my iPod would only sync to the computer at my parents house. Â So at the first opportunity I went to buy the Hot Fuss album, and listened to it all the time on my cd player. Whilst writing this post Iâ€™m listening to Haim, winners of the BBC Sound of 2013, on Spotify. The â€˜related artistsâ€™ tab is showing me I might like AlunaGeorge, Alex Winston, The Neighbourhood and Jessie Ware amongst others. Â Some good suggestions seeing as Iâ€™ve already listened to the odd track from a couple of the aforementioned artists, and Iâ€™m likely to give the others a listen too. Â And I was only listening to Haim in the first place because Huw Stephens had been plugging them massively on his Radio 1 show, and Iâ€™m easily influenced! Of course, gigs are a good way of finding new music. Â I didnâ€™t used to make much of an effort to get to a gig in time to see the support band, but the truth is you never know when you might catch the next big thing. Â I saw Lily Allen on tour a couple of years ago and her warm up act was the glass shattering La Roux. Â Some of the notes she sang Iâ€™m convinced would only ever be heard by dogs, but she was memorable. I also love festivals as a source of inspiration. Â Take Glastonbury, where else would you see the Arctic Monkeys and Shirley Bassey on the same stage on the same day? Â Sometimes you may stick around after a band has finished, go along to see [insert band name here] in an attempt not to get seperated from your friends, or catch part of a set whilst youâ€™re walking past. Â Sometimes people ask me why Iâ€™m willing to buy Glastonbury tickets without knowing who will be performing? Â If you listen to mainstream music youâ€™re bound to find some of your favourite festival acts on the Pyramid stage, but take it as an opportunity to learn about music you might not have necessarily heard elsewhere. Iâ€™ve started scanning local gig listings for all the bands playing in the local area, and picking some out at random. Â Last week my boyfriend suggested we go and see a band that neither of us had heard before play at the Academy. Â New discoveries, this is where it starts...

Dette fÃ¸rte til at svÃ¦rt fÃ¥ setninger av "An Introduction to Nineteenth Century Art" festet seg i minnet. For Ã¥ prÃ¸ve og ikke sovne Ã¥pnet jeg Spotify og hÃ¸rte pÃ¥ Divine (og litt Sexy Sushi). Denne karen er kjent fra John Waters tidlige underground filmer som Pink Flamingos, Female Trouble og luktefilmen Polyester. Ved siden Ã¥ vÃ¦re skuespiller var han ogsÃ¥ en "sanger". Musikken hans bestÃ¥r mest av cheesy 80s toner og fengende tekster. Sangene hans setter meg alltid i et godt humÃ¸r og fungerer for meg som Red Bull. NÃ¥r jeg satt pÃ¥ biblioteket og ikke hadde nok hjernekapasitet til Ã¥ fortsette lesninger kunne jeg like godt dra frem tegneblokken. Da gjorde jeg vÃ¦rtfall noe produktivt mens jeg ventet pÃ¥ min venninne skulle bli ferdig med lesningen (etterhvert viste det seg at hun ogsÃ¥ brukte den siste timen pÃ¥ helt andre ting, nemlig lese femti sider av Tom Egelands Skyggelandet).Â Jeg har lenge hatt en ide som Ã¥ lage et portrett av Divine, sÃ¥ nÃ¥r jeg fÃ¸rst hadde musikken hans pÃ¥ Ã¸ret kunne jeg like gjerne starte! Denne tegningen tok meg ikke lenger enn 1 time, og jeg mÃ¥tte bruke penner jeg fant i skolepenalet, sÃ¥ fargetusjene er egentlig ikke egnet som tegnetusjer. Denne tegningen var for meg ogsÃ¥ en utmerket mulighet til Ã¥ Ã¸ve pÃ¥ teknikk pÃ¥. Bildet er i A4 format. SÃ¥ for de som undrer seg. Hvem er denne chubby drag queenen? Denne musikkvideoen forklarer ganske mye: Â Ã˜nsker dere en riktig god mandag alle sammen!

post.title: Llegim i Piulem, tuitertÃºlia en catalÃ
post.summary: Llegim i Piulem es una tuitertulia sobre literatura catalana. Un proyecto que nace en 2010 alrededor de un blog, donde se proponen las lecturas, y que se desarrolla en Twitter donde los participantes de la tertulia debaten, escriben poesÃ­a, narran historias,... en definitiva, comparten la experiencia lectora. Una experiencia que ademÃ¡s, echa mano de otros medios 2.0 para enriquecerse: crean listas de canciones como banda sonora de la lectura utilizando Spotify,Â amplÃ­anÂ informaciÃ³n sobre el autor y sus obras con una recopilaciÃ³n de enlaces en Diigo, dedican exposiciones en Pinterest... El proyecto cuenta ya con un Premio Blocs de Catalunya (2011) al Mejor Blog Corporativo de Literatura. Su Ã©xito en la red ademÃ¡s ha servido para que en ocasiones la tertulia se haya trasladado tambiÃ©n al mundo offline, llevando a cabo ademÃ¡s encuentros con autores.Me he puesto en contacto con las responsables de la iniciativa para saber algo mÃ¡s de Llegim i Piulem, y han accedido a informarme(nos) sobre el proyecto:Com va sorgir la idea, qui estÃ darrere de Llegim i Piulem i com van ser els comenÃ§aments?@Judithvips va trobar una notÃ­ciaÂ referida a un club de lectura a Twitter ben exitÃ³s als Estats Units i en va fer una piulada... prenyadora.Immediatament, @npiniÂ va viralitzar aquell tweet i, aixÃ­, entre a d'altra gent, va arribar a @lalectora.Â Totes tres ens vam engrescar amb la idea de reproduir aquella idea i compartir l'experiÃ¨ncia lectora d'obres de literatura catalana.Com escolliu les eines 2.0 que utilitzeu i com han fet evolucionar l'experiÃ¨ncia?La tertÃºlia es desenvolupa a Twitter, perÃ² lâ€™anunci de la tertÃºlia es fa en el bloc de Llegimipiulem. Segons l'argument de l'obra o el pes en aquella d'una determinada dimensiÃ³: grÃ fica, musical, geogrÃ fica, ens decantem per una Â o una altra ferramenta 2.0 que la pose de manifest i permeta als lectors deixar-se captivar per la proposta i Â jugar-hi una mica durant i desprÃ©s de la lectura. Amb "Xocolata desfeta", el llibre amb quÃ¨ ens vam estrenar, vam obrir ja un compte a Spotify (si es dÃ³na el cas, creem una llista dâ€™Spotify amb la mÃºsica de cada llibre que proposem). Amb "Contes de la veritat oculta", de Pere Calders, vam estrenar-nos a Pinterest i a Diigo. Ara amb "El talent", hem usat lâ€™Scoop.itDistingim tambÃ© entre les eines que recullen i arxiven la tertÃºlia i entre les que l'animen o l'amplien (Neoformix, Scribdâ€¦).QuÃ¨ destacarÃ­eu del projecte Llegim i Piulem? Una mica del que us sentiu especialment orgulls@sQue tres persones que no es coneixien (i que van trobar-se per primera vegada desprÃ©s dâ€™haver parlant molt per la xarxa) i que sÃ³n ben diferents es dediquen, grÃ cies a les possibilitats que els ofereix la xarxa, a llegir plegades i compartir aquesta experiÃ¨ncia, al fet que ho fan des de fa temps i pel sincer plaer de fer-ho. Pel fet de veure com, de vegades, tot compartint amb altri lectures prÃ²pies passen coses precioses [<--RT!].Una de les coses que tambÃ© ens satisfÃ Ã©s que fem arribar el recull de piulades als autors dels llibres i poden veure â€˜el retornâ€™ dels lectors de la seva obra.Ens ha agradat tambÃ© poder colâ€¢laborar en lâ€™any literari de Joan Sales, Calders i TÃ­sner.Â I veure com ens comencen a seguir forces instituts, que proven dâ€™utilitzar la mateixa filosofia de LlegimipiulemÂ [<--RT!]Â per a les seves classes de literatura: proposen una etiqueta perquÃ¨ la mainada piuli sobre un llibre concret. Nous reptes, noves maneres.I tambÃ© de lâ€™etiqueta #piulempoesia, que vam proposar-la el Dia de la Poesia Catalana a Internet (17 de marÃ§) i que ha pres volada, perquÃ¨ ja sÃ³n molts els que la fan servir.Escriptor catalÃ mÃ©s "piuler"?SÃ³n molts els escriptors que han participat en les tertÃºlies o en actes relacionats amb les tertÃºlies (@joanlluislluis, @josepcampmajo â€“amb qui vam fer la primera tuittertÃºlia), @iolandabatalle, @belolid, Santiago FornÃ©, @janquim... Ara que fem #Eltalent, @jordinopca tambÃ© sâ€™afegeix a piular-hi coses...Per a finalitzar, unes paraules per a animar a la gent a participar en Llegim i PiulemCrec que sempre s'ha d'animar les persones, sobretot si te les estimes, a llegir, a buscar espai per a la lectura. A buscar llibres que Â els interessen i els arriben, els toquen. Si, a mÃ©s, en volen compartir l'experiÃ¨ncia, potser, Llegimipiulem serÃ un espai mÃ©s on poder fer-ho...Rosa Lizandra va fer un tuit que ens agrada molt perquÃ¨ resumeix molt bÃ© el que intentem fer: "Amb @llegimipiulem llegir ha deixat de ser un acte individual".

post.title: The Crystal Caravan - We Always Lose
post.summary: Monday, a new week again and it's time to present this week's album. A band that I got tipped off by the "Chief Rebel" some time ago, a record that would suit me in the taste, which it did, however, have never written about these uncles before, but the record has grown and spun a lot on my iPod and Spotify, no, unfortunately I do not own this yet. However, a Vinyl, it will be eventually, hopefully. This weeks album is "Against The Rising Tide", the 2:nd album made by the Swedish band "The Crystal Caravan". The band is from upnorth in Sweden, a town called UmeÃ¥, who debuted in 2009 with a self-titled CD, at the record company Garageland Records. 2010 the band released Against The Rising Tide of Transcendental Substance Records. The music is strongly influenced 60's and 70's rock. It's spontaneous, warm, rich, analog and intimate, with a good vibe. The singing part is brilliant, what a kick he has in his vocal pipe, all this backed by a really tight band that creates an incredible swing, can snatch any old timer any time for a dance. This record is highly recommended. Todays tune "We'll Always Lose" is a real kicker, with a exploding riff which takes you on a wild ride in history.. More info @ Official The Crystal Caravan Web Listen to "The Crystal Caravan- We Always Lose" on Spotify here! Follow tuneoftheday.blogspot.com on Spotify here!

post.title: a wintry morning
post.summary:
this is what i need, right now: to tell you you are loved. just as you are, right now.
the hibernating? it is important to where you are going. hibernate now and you will come out rested when it is time. resisting the cold? is ok.Â resistanceÂ is ok. you are human. you can not let go of everything. you cannot be a saint. you are human. bodies have desire, they have wants, they have temperatures that they do not appreciate being exposed to. they hurt when the cold pierces through the layers or you forget to pull your hood up to cover your poor ears. it is possibly to be gentle. to heal the need to push through and punish. and it is possible to draw on your inner resources when you need to push harder.
and it is okay to hurt. it is part of the desire of the body, because if you did not hurt, you would not recognize what hurts you and be able to do something about it (which sometimes includes nothing). you do not owe anyone anything. you do not even owe yourself anything, except what you want to owe. wake up and choose.
what i need to tell you, what i need to tell me is this: we are one. just oneness. our hurts, our desires, our love, our fear, our thoughts, our bodies. there is no letting go because it is really all one thing. there is noÂ resistanceÂ because it is one thing. the choice you are making right now, in this moment, is just the choice you are making right now, in this moment. every moment can be a new choice.
this doesn't mean that you should curl up in a ball on the couch everyday (there is no should). but it is okay to do this when you need to. it is more than okay, it is necessary.
ebb and flow.
everyone and everything follows the ebb and the flow, no matter how much they push. (and it is okay to push. we are human. we are human.) we must ebb. we must flow. sometimes we choose to resist. we do not need to, but we also do not need to not need to. we're still going to ebb and flow. even in resistance.
ebb and flow.
here is the choice i choose right now: writing this to you, to myself. listening to my "gray day" spotify playlist and dancing when i moved to dance. drinking all my coffee and then switching to tea and writing words of love on facebook because connections matter.
i have a new book to start reading. i have projects to start. it is snowing again (which is supposed to change to ice and then to rain) and i am resenting this last day before the weather changes and gives me a respite from the cold for a few days.
i am also grateful that it isn't below freezing as it was last week. i am in love with this life, this place i haveÂ chosenÂ to live in. but i am also in love with my body not hurting from the cold. i am ebb and i am flow and i am noticing how they work in my body in this season, right now.

post.title: Hp Envy x2, anÃ¡lisis
post.summary:
Un inscription y un portÃ¡til. No â€œun inscription o un portÃ¡tilâ€ o â€œun portÃ¡til que a ratos es un tabletâ€. El posicionamiento de Hp con el Envy x2 es que estÃ¡n ofreciendo ambas cosas a la vez en una sola compra y que ese el bravery diferencial de este equipo extraÃ­ble: desconectas la pantalla del wharf y lo que hasta ese momento era un ultrabook de repente pasa a ser una tableta. Es el tipo de propuestas de bravery que Windows 8 permite, con sus dos entornos e interfaces diferenciados. El Hp Envy x2 viene gobernado por la versiÃ³n del sistema operativo de Microsoft â€œpara ordenadoresâ€, no con el mÃ¡s limitado Windows RT. Esto a priori posibilita el tipo de equipo que uno quiere alcanzar con Windows 8: algo ligero para trabajar en movilidad, con un enfoque marcado por la productividad, pero que tambiÃ©n permita una gran experiencia en modo â€œestoy en el sofÃ¡ leyendo, viendo algo de vÃ­deo o usando Twitterâ€.
BÃ¡sicamente lo que Hp pretende conseguir con el Envy x2, ser a la vez un inscription y un portÃ¡til. Toca en este anÃ¡lisis intentar discernir si lo han conseguido. Veamos Hp Envy x2, caracterÃ­sticas tÃ©cnicas Hp Envy x2 se presenta con unas caracterÃ­sticas que pivotan entre lo que esperamos de cada tipo de dispositivo: micro Intel Atom doble nÃºcleo a 1,80GHz, dos gigas de memoria RAM, 64 GB de disco, conectividad NFC, sonido Beats Audio, salida HDMI y cÃ¡mara de 8 megapÃ­xeles. La pantalla es de 11.6 pulgadas, con resoluciÃ³n de 1.366Ã—768 pÃ­xeles. El row es de tipo IPS y con brillo de 400 nits. Un detalle no pardonable es el peso: el completo del equipo es de 1.4 Kg, por 700 gramos cuando uno separa la pantalla para quedar en modo tablet.
DiseÃ±o y acabado En este aspecto el Hp Envy x2 estÃ¡ a un nivel sobresaliente. El acabado en aluminio es magnÃ­fico y todos los detalles denotan que se han trabajado mucho los acabados. El equipo se presenta en tone plata y destaca sobre todo por lo fino que resulta: la pantalla queda en 8.55mm y el conjunto resulta extremadamente delgado. QuizÃ¡s por ese motivo en Hp han tomado una decisiÃ³n strange en la disposiciÃ³n del botÃ³n de encendido y en el de volumen: no estÃ¡n en el parallel sino que los encontramos en la parte trasera de la pantalla. Nada a lo que uno no pueda acostumbrarse y que, ademÃ¡s, en el modo de sujeciÃ³n inscription resulta bastante cÃ³modo (menos en el modo portÃ¡til, que te obliga a estar adivinando donde estÃ¡) Los puertos quedan en el dock, con un USB (sÃ³lo 2.0) en cada lado. A la izquierda tenemos tambiÃ©n la salida HDMI y a la derecha el lector de tarjetas. Como no podÃ­a ser de otra manera en un equipo tan ligero, ni rastro de Ethernet ni mucho menos de VGA. Y sÃ­, podrÃ­amos discutir si Hp sigue una la lÃ­nea de diseÃ±o de Apple con sus portÃ¡tiles. En todo caso, es un tema del que ya se ha hablado mucho y sobre el que uno no deja de pensar en que grain una parte razonable (parecerse a Apple en el sentido de que se parecen a aspectos que el mercado estÃ¡ recibiendo bien) y que grain una parte en la que Hp tiene una gran necesidad de un lenguaje de diseÃ±o propio.
Teclado y trackpad Como en otros equipos con Windows 8, el aspecto que con mÃ¡s prioridad he analizado es el trackpad. Al basarse en gestos, el sistema operativo de Microsoft ha puesto en bravery una de las caracterÃ­sticas â€“ el uso de un trackpad â€“ que su usuario medio histÃ³ricamente no habÃ­a adoptado. Si los nuevos equipos no ponen soluciÃ³n a esto, la experiencia de Windows 8 puede resultar bastante incompleta. En el caso del Hp Envy x2, el trackpad tiene un nivel notable. Por un lado la respuesta y la experiencia con gestos es bastante solvente, pero no llega al sobresaliente por la apariciÃ³n â€“ no demasiado frecuente eso sÃ­ â€“ de Ã³rdenes que uno no querÃ­a dar pero el sistema interpreta como dadas. De hecho, una de las cosas que primero configurarÃ­a en este equipo es deshabilitar el gesto de deslizar desde la izquierda del trackpad para cambiar de aplicaciÃ³n, algo que mÃ¡s de una vez me ha saltado sin desearlo. Al teclado sÃ³lo le falta ser retroiluminado para ser completo. En los Ãºltimos tiempos los teclados de Hp estÃ¡n a un gran nivel y en este caso, a pesar de que el tamaÃ±o no es mi ideal (no deja de ser un equipo pequeÃ±o y llega a compromisos), la respuesta ha sido realmente buena.
Pantalla, sonido y calor 11.6 pulgadas con resoluciÃ³n de 1.366Ã—768 son un compromiso que muestra que lo que busca el x2 no es posible sin hacer algunos sacrificios. La resoluciÃ³n es razonable en un ultraportÃ¡til de estas dimensiones y precio, pero para un inscription se queda algo corta en los estÃ¡ndares de gama alta del mercado. La diferencia en la distancia que uno toma respecto al dispositivo hace que sea complicado elegir una resoluciÃ³n Ã³ptima para ambos casos. Donde sÃ­ me ha sorprendido gratamente el Hp Envy x2 es en su uso en modo tablet. Pensaba que con mÃ¡s de 11 pulgadas iba a tener sensaciÃ³n de tener un cacharro demasiado grande en las manos y no ha sido el caso. Resulta muy ligero â€“ de nuevo, no tanto como los Ãºltimos tablets especializados, pero muy cerca de ellos â€“ y delgado, de forma que he estado razonablemente cÃ³modo en los contextos habituales de uso del tablet: sofÃ¡, cama, baÃ±o. De hecho en la cama le he encontrado la ventaja de que al tener el wharf no he necesitado buscar otro tipo de soluciones cuando he querido ver un vÃ­deo con Ã©l.
El sonido apuntaba a ser uno de los puntos fuertes del equipo, pero hemos encontrado un rendimiento desigual. Por un lado tenemos que con altavoces las sensaciones han sido pobres, tanto en potencia como en calidad del audio; con auriculares ha mejorado mucha la experiencia del Envy, que ademÃ¡s viene con la vitola de incorporar el sistema Beats. En el diseÃ±o del equipo parece que han tenido la Ãºltima prioridad con los altavoces y o bien quedan machacados por el wharf o bien por la sujeciÃ³n manual. En cuanto a temperatura, sin noticia en el frente, que es lo que mejor se puede decir. Horas y horas de uso no han conseguido calentar el equipo, verbigracia del micro Intel Atom que en este aspecto marca un excelente comportamiento.
Rendimiento inscription / portÃ¡til y autonomÃ­a del x2 En este apartado vamos a encontrar lo mejor y lo peor del Hp Envy x2. En autonomÃ­a el contar con dos baterÃ­as convierten a este equipo en todo un campeÃ³n: el fabricante apunta a 14 horas, servidor ha conseguido tenerlo once horas y media aprovechando las dos baterÃ­as de las que dispone, una en el wharf y otra en la pantalla. Para un inscription no es algo desproporcionado (usando sÃ³lo el equipo en modo inscription he conseguido estirarlo a las siete horas y veinte minutos), pero para un portÃ¡til es una marca sobresaliente. En cuanto a rendimiento la doble personalidad del Hp Envy x2 se revela como en ninguna otra faceta. Como inscription el comportamiento es sobresaliente, mueve el sistema a la maravilla y entre las aplicaciones â€œModern UIâ€ de Windows 8 y el uso de Explorer 10 (que a mÃ¡s de uno sorprenderÃ­a lo bien que va), se consigue una muy buena experiencia (mejorable en cuanto haya mÃ¡s aplicaciones adaptadas a la tienda de Microsoft).
Donde encontramos limitaciones importantes es en su uso como portÃ¡til. AquÃ­ debemos levantar una salvaguarda: estamos ante un Intel Atom con dos gigas de RAM, no se puede equiparar a los equipos portÃ¡tiles que llevan micros i5 y empiezan en las cuatro gigas de RAM. El resultado en el caso del Envy x2 es que para un uso bÃ¡sico de navegador mÃ¡s alguna aplicaciÃ³n extra, es solvente; en el caso de Chrome con muchas pestaÃ±as, Dropbox y Skydrive a la vez redisentes, Picassa abierto para editar fotos, algÃºn cliente Twitter y Spotify sonando con mÃºsica (mi caso habitual), el sistema tiene relantizaciones y le cuesta moverlo. Lo mismo aplica al espacio en disco. 64 Gigas de los que el sistema se come de entrada 20 pueden valer para un tablet, pero se quedan muy cortas en un portÃ¡til. AquÃ­ grain que tirar de almacenamiento externo o de la nube necesariamente.
Hp Envy x2: inscription y portÃ¡til. La opiniÃ³n de Xataka Algo a destacar es que el el mecanismo de extracciÃ³n de la pantalla funciona muy bien y no es para nada complicado o con peligro de estropear la pantalla. El rango de inclinaciÃ³n de la misma en modo portÃ¡til es limitado, eso sÃ­, pero en ubiquitous el change que hacemos en con el Hp Envy x2 es que realmente es posible tener un equipo que sea a su vez un inscription y un portÃ¡til. En todo caso creemos muy necesario entender muy bien quÃ© se estÃ¡ comprando para manejar expectativas. Como inscription pierde en resoluciÃ³n con respecto a los lÃ­deres del mercado, ademÃ¡s de ser un poco mayor con las 11.6 pulgadas, pero ofrece una gran experiencia moviendo el sistema. La cÃ¡mara es decente â€“ si es que os animÃ¡is a tirar fotos con un cacharro de este tamaÃ±o â€“ y la disponible para conferencias tambiÃ©n estÃ¡ a buen nivel, pero sin destacar especialmente.
Como portÃ¡til lo importante es tener claro donde estÃ¡n sus limitaciones: un Atom puede inciter Windows 8, pero en modo escritorio el nÃºmero de aplicaciones y multitarea tiene un tope no difÃ­cil de conseguir a partir del cual el sistema deja de ir fluido y se perjudica la productividad. El precio de venta es de 1000 euros a dÃ­a de hoy. No es demasiado caro si tenemos en cuenta que deberÃ­a resolver la labor de dos dispositivos y que la calidad de los componentes y el acabado son notables, pero, insisto, es un equipo con el que grain que tener claro los compromisos que hace: es un inscription de notable, en portÃ¡til se queda corto en potencia y espacio respecto a un ultrabook de un precio identical o menor.
