post.title: Hp Envy x2, anÃ¡lisis
post.summary:
Un tablet y un portÃ¡til. No â€œun tablet o un portÃ¡tilâ€ o â€œun portÃ¡til que a ratos es un tabletâ€. El posicionamiento de Hp con el Envy x2 es que estÃ¡n ofreciendo ambas cosas a la vez en una sola compra y que ese el valor diferencial de este equipo extraÃ­ble: desconectas la pantalla del dock y lo que hasta ese momento era un ultrabook de repente pasa a ser una tableta. Es el tipo de propuestas de valor que Windows 8 permite, con sus dos entornos e interfaces diferenciados. El Hp Envy x2 viene gobernado por la versiÃ³n del sistema operativo de Microsoft â€œpara ordenadoresâ€, no con el mÃ¡s limitado Windows RT. Esto a priori posibilita el tipo de equipo que uno quiere alcanzar con Windows 8: algo ligero para trabajar en movilidad, con un enfoque marcado por la productividad, pero que tambiÃ©n permita una gran experiencia en modo â€œestoy en el sofÃ¡ leyendo, viendo algo de vÃ­deo o usando Twitterâ€.
BÃ¡sicamente lo que Hp pretende conseguir con el Envy x2, ser a la vez un tablet y un portÃ¡til. Toca en este anÃ¡lisis intentar discernir si lo han conseguido. Veamos Hp Envy x2, caracterÃ­sticas tÃ©cnicas Hp Envy x2 se presenta con unas caracterÃ­sticas que pivotan entre lo que esperamos de cada tipo de dispositivo: micro Intel Atom doble nÃºcleo a 1,80GHz, dos gigas de memoria RAM, 64 GB de disco, conectividad NFC, sonido Beats Audio, salida HDMI y cÃ¡mara de 8 megapÃ­xeles. La pantalla es de 11.6 pulgadas, con resoluciÃ³n de 1.366Ã—768 pÃ­xeles. El panel es de tipo IPS y con brillo de 400 nits. Un detalle no trivial es el peso: el completo del equipo es de 1.4 Kg, por 700 gramos cuando uno separa la pantalla para quedar en modo tablet.
DiseÃ±o y acabado En este aspecto el Hp Envy x2 estÃ¡ a un nivel sobresaliente. El acabado en aluminio es magnÃ­fico y todos los detalles denotan que se han trabajado mucho los acabados. El equipo se presenta en color plata y destaca sobre todo por lo fino que resulta: la pantalla queda en 8.55mm y el conjunto resulta extremadamente delgado. QuizÃ¡s por ese motivo en Hp han tomado una decisiÃ³n original en la disposiciÃ³n del botÃ³n de encendido y en el de volumen: no estÃ¡n en el lateral sino que los encontramos en la parte trasera de la pantalla. Nada a lo que uno no pueda acostumbrarse y que, ademÃ¡s, en el modo de sujeciÃ³n tablet resulta bastante cÃ³modo (menos en el modo portÃ¡til, que te obliga a estar adivinando donde estÃ¡) Los puertos quedan en el dock, con un USB (sÃ³lo 2.0) en cada lado. A la izquierda tenemos tambiÃ©n la salida HDMI y a la derecha el lector de tarjetas. Como no podÃ­a ser de otra manera en un equipo tan ligero, ni rastro de Ethernet ni mucho menos de VGA. Y sÃ­, podrÃ­amos discutir si Hp sigue una la lÃ­nea de diseÃ±o de Apple con sus portÃ¡tiles. En todo caso, es un tema del que ya se ha hablado mucho y sobre el que uno no deja de pensar en que hay una parte razonable (parecerse a Apple en el sentido de que se parecen a aspectos que el mercado estÃ¡ recibiendo bien) y que hay una parte en la que Hp tiene una gran necesidad de un lenguaje de diseÃ±o propio.
Teclado y trackpad Como en otros equipos con Windows 8, el aspecto que con mÃ¡s prioridad he analizado es el trackpad. Al basarse en gestos, el sistema operativo de Microsoft ha puesto en valor una de las caracterÃ­sticas â€“ el uso de un trackpad â€“ que su usuario medio histÃ³ricamente no habÃ­a adoptado. Si los nuevos equipos no ponen soluciÃ³n a esto, la experiencia de Windows 8 puede resultar bastante incompleta. En el caso del Hp Envy x2, el trackpad tiene un nivel notable. Por un lado la respuesta y la experiencia con gestos es bastante solvente, pero no llega al sobresaliente por la apariciÃ³n â€“ no demasiado frecuente eso sÃ­ â€“ de Ã³rdenes que uno no querÃ­a dar pero el sistema interpreta como dadas. De hecho, una de las cosas que primero configurarÃ­a en este equipo es deshabilitar el gesto de deslizar desde la izquierda del trackpad para cambiar de aplicaciÃ³n, algo que mÃ¡s de una vez me ha saltado sin desearlo. Al teclado sÃ³lo le falta ser retroiluminado para ser completo. En los Ãºltimos tiempos los teclados de Hp estÃ¡n a un gran nivel y en este caso, a pesar de que el tamaÃ±o no es mi ideal (no deja de ser un equipo pequeÃ±o y llega a compromisos), la respuesta ha sido realmente buena.
Pantalla, sonido y calor 11.6 pulgadas con resoluciÃ³n de 1.366Ã—768 son un compromiso que muestra que lo que busca el x2 no es posible sin hacer algunos sacrificios. La resoluciÃ³n es razonable en un ultraportÃ¡til de estas dimensiones y precio, pero para un tablet se queda algo corta en los estÃ¡ndares de gama alta del mercado. La diferencia en la distancia que uno toma respecto al dispositivo hace que sea complicado elegir una resoluciÃ³n Ã³ptima para ambos casos. Donde sÃ­ me ha sorprendido gratamente el Hp Envy x2 es en su uso en modo tablet. Pensaba que con mÃ¡s de 11 pulgadas iba a tener sensaciÃ³n de tener un cacharro demasiado grande en las manos y no ha sido el caso. Resulta muy ligero â€“ de nuevo, no tanto como los Ãºltimos tablets especializados, pero muy cerca de ellos â€“ y delgado, de forma que he estado razonablemente cÃ³modo en los contextos habituales de uso del tablet: sofÃ¡, cama, baÃ±o. De hecho en la cama le he encontrado la ventaja de que al tener el dock no he necesitado buscar otro tipo de soluciones cuando he querido ver un vÃ­deo con Ã©l.

En el diseÃ±o del equipo parece que han tenido la Ãºltima prioridad con los altavoces y o bien quedan machacados por el dock o bien por la sujeciÃ³n manual. En cuanto a temperatura, sin noticia en el frente, que es lo que mejor se puede decir. post.title: Spotify Essentials: The 2013 Coachella undercard
post.summary: Blur, the Stone Roses, Phoenix and Red Hot Chili Peppers top the lineup for the 2013 Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival, which was unveiled late on Thursday night (Jan. 24). The annual fest is set to once again take over Indio, Calif. on Blur, the Stone Roses, Phoenix and Red Hot Chili Peppers will headline the annual three-day Coachella Valley Music and Arts Festival to be held at the Empire Polo Club in Indio, California, on consecutive weekends, April 12 through 14 and April 19 For Brit-pop fans, Thursday night's Coachella announcement was like a birthday, Christmas, Hannukah and an unexpected inheritance check all arriving at once. Devotees of the dance-leaning Sahara Tent, however, might be taken aback by the light bill of Coachella 2013 Lineup â€“ Official Full List Bands, Schedule Announced. Blur, Stone Roses, Phoenix, Red Hot Chili Peppers headlining. Coachella's 2013 lineup left a few concert-goers feeling underwhelmed.

post.title: GRIN OF THE CHESHIRE CAT is back
post.summary: After quite a while not being listed on the various online music portals, my album GRIN OF THE CHESHIRE CAT is now available for pourchase on the major ones including iTunes, Amazon and Spotify. Even if you are not interested in buying, some feedback would be nice as this also helps me get known amongst the public.
post.blogName: News and blog for Dr. Jules on Blogspot

Der Music Hub soll einerseits zukÃ¼nftig in deutlich mehr LÃ¤ndern verfÃ¼gbar sein - aktuell ist der Service nur in sechs LÃ¤ndern verfÃ¼gbar -, andererseits soll er auf mehr GerÃ¤ten nutzbar sein. Neben dem Galaxy SIII und dem Note 2 kann man, geht es nach Samsung, bald auf allen Android-GerÃ¤ten Musik streamen. Das hat TJ Kang, seines Zeichens Vize von Samsung Media Services, auf der MIDEM in Cannes in einem Interview angekÃ¼ndigt. Einen Zeitplan fÃ¼r die Expansion gebe es aktuell noch nicht, die Lizenzverhandlungen mit den Rechteinhabern der Musik liefen jedoch bereits. Was Samsung im Auge hat, ist klar: ran an die Mittbewerber wie Amazon, Apple und Google, von Spotify & Co. ganz zu schweigen. ReadÂ |Â PermalinkÂ |Â Email thisÂ |Â Comments

post.title: Actress - Silver Cloud: caer al vacÃ­o, pasarse de abstracto
post.summary: Rasgando el surco del vinilo rayado, el jack que conecta con el correspondiente ampli sin enchufar antes de sonar o la mÃ¡quina marcando las pulsaciones constantes de un maniquÃ­ operado. Actress tiene otra idea en la cabeza ajena al consumo rÃ¡pido y al 4Ã—4 de baile. Ã‰l se recrea en los largos desarrollos hasta dar salida a una nueva entrega bajo el tÃ­tulo de Silver Cloud (2013, Werk Discs) donde lo mismo nos transporta con Ã©xito a su ciudad inventada que se queda pidiendo agua en el desierto. Las sensaciones fallan en corto Actress cada vez parece irse mÃ¡s lejos de su Techno inicial, en el cual incorporaba con Ã©xito raÃ­ces negras, el Dub Techno alemÃ¡n y otras tantas ideas que al final le acababan llevando a ser un posible sucesor de Aphex Twin corriendo desde fuera, en paralelo, aÃºn con todo por delante para ganarse en realidad tal calificativo. Darren J. Cunningham en largo me fascina. Lleva tres Ã¡lbumes claves para entender por dÃ³nde estÃ¡ cambiando cierta electrÃ³nica de carÃ¡cter minimalista a finales de la primera dÃ©cada del 2000 y comienzos de la segunda. Ahora, en corto, en formato 12â€, donde el clÃ­max se crea en solo 22 minutos, sus Ãºltimas aventuras son bastante corrientes (y si no estuviÃ©semos hablando de Actress lo mismo hubiesen pasado desapercibidas). En 2012 se apunto a la serie â€œMeets Shangaan Electroâ€œ de Honest Jonâ€™s Records y el ritmo groovy de sus dos temas tenÃ­a su aquel como completismo, como curiosidad. Con Metamorphosis (2012, Werk) directamente es mejor pasar. Y ahora con Silver Cloud nos deja un gran single (que en su caso no es tal) para despuÃ©s privarlo de compaÃ±Ã­a. Actress concreta El artista britÃ¡nico ya no provoca el baile ni siquiera en corto. Como mÃ¡ximo provoca el baile del soma. En este sentido podrÃ­amos relacionarlo con los movimientos hacia afuera de alguien tan grande como Vladislav Delay que va al margen o los sonidos de la ciudad de Deepchord pero sin la capacidad de baile. Ahora bien, como Actress siga buscando la fÃ³rmula mÃ¡s minimalista, prescindiendo de cualquier pomposidad o efectismo va a acabar en la MÃºsica concreta en dos dÃ­as mÃ¡s. Ya no tiene tan lejos nombres revolucionarios como Pierre Henry o Pierre Schaeffer y sus Symphone Pour Un Homme Seul (1950). Y al mismo tiempo que cito a dicha pareja podrÃ­amos hablar de toda esa escena en la que incluir a Luc Ferrari, Edgar VarÃ¨se y tantos otros. Por el momento Actress no ha llegado a tal dominio de la aparente nada. Ã‰l sigue denso, entre drones y capas densas que pesan un quintal en temas como â€˜Floating in Ecstasyâ€˜, donde solo flota Ã©l mientras yo prefiero pinchar tal burbuja por tedio. Compro â€˜Voodo Posse Chronic Illusionâ€˜ porque me fascina. No es casual que en este caso se marque su tema con mayor duraciÃ³n de su carrera. Casi 12 minutos en los que tira de Glitch, quema las ondas y va superponiendo capas hasta que logro disfrutar de su visiÃ³n abstracta, algo que no me pasa con el resto, â€˜Silver Cloud Dream Come Trueâ€˜ incluida. Otra travesÃ­a de esas que este tipo de artistas se marcan en el desierto sin mucho Ambient y poca miga, de esas en las que mis queridos amigos dirÃ­an â€œÂ¿cuÃ¡ndo va a pasar algo?â€ (pese a que tampoco sea necesario que ocurra algo para el disfrute). Silver Cloud avanza un Actress cada vez mÃ¡s vacÃ­o en forma y discurso. Pena que no todo sea como el primer zarpazo. La siguiente entrega esperada: Ghettoville. Hay margen para mil cambios mÃ¡s. EscÃºchalo en | Spotify En HipersÃ³nica | Actress â€“ R.I.P: la fragmentaciÃ³n como concepto En HipersÃ³nica | Actress â€“ Splazsh: el mejor disco de mÃºsica electrÃ³nica de 2010

post.title: Music Discovery Is A Burned Out Phrase
post.summary:
By freelance music writer Tyler Hayes (@thealbumproject).
Previously only for those seeking out new music, music discovery is now
something forced on the average Internet citizen from companies looking to
expand subscription music and rebuild after the Napster fall. Rather than
making real progress towards helping people find new music to listen to, the
'music discovery' terminology is on the verge of its 'social networking'
moment as it gets wildly exploited and burns out into a million little buzz
words.
If music discovery faces an inherent problem, it's that most people stop
looking for music after their youth. Not a hard data point, but a fact that
can easily be verified at any time by asking a 30 something what the last
album they bought, or even what the last band they listened to was. This is a
problem for music services like Spotify and Rdio, it's not a problem for
iTunes. Digital distribution means that as long as iTunes sells a handful of
tracks, enough to keep the lights on relatively speaking, that Apple doesn't
mind, it's simply a value add for them. Spotify, on the other hand thrives on
premium subscriptions. Individuals paying them $10 a month to listen to as
many or as few songs as they choose. Ads are a nice addition to the business
for posterity sake, but ads don't make the wheels go round.
Do you see where I'm going with this? Music discovery has to become a buzz
word. It has to be something that gets pushed down people's throats or Spotify
and subscription music lose. People don't pay $10 a month to listen to old
Weezer songs over and over again, or at least they shouldn't. Buying less than
12 albums or 120 songs a year means that it's probably cheaper, or a better
bet, to buy the music out right and "own" it, verse renting. The goal is to
sell people on the idea that they'll have access to essentially infinite
music, that they need an endless supply because they are constantly
discovering the latest and greatest music, more than they could afford to buy.
It doesn't matter how a person is discovering new music, whether at the
grocery store or by using one of Spotify's third party apps, what matters is
how much they're discovering. Every person discovers some new music over the
course of their life. The issue is I don't see a fundamental change happening
in the music discovery space, only a coat of paint and flashy banners. If
anything in the current space could have awoken a sense of urgency to discover
new music it would have been Pandora. An automated system that steers your
musical choices in a certain direction based on your interests? Seems
wonderful.
The problem with Pandora is that it may replace the radio for some,
or a lot of people, but there is no spark the same way when a friend says
"Hey, you should check out this band, they're great." A computer can't replace
that, yet. There will be an app or site or service that does fix and solve
discovery because I believe in technology's ability to replace almost anything
that came before, to improve or outdate things from existence. But that isn't
now or even this year.
Music discovery should be a verb or an accident, through active looking or
serendipitous stumbling, but it shouldn't be paraded around only as a
marketing term. A lot of people caught on quick to the over use of 'social
networking' to describe everything a few years ago. If your new start up or
revamp of an existing product didn't have a social aspect to it, forget it,
pack it in because it fell on deaf ears. I dread the same thing happening to
music discovery, yet it's already starting. Every music service seems to
actively or subtly imply it's their service that will actually help you find
new music. So when you're drawn in with the promise of discovery take a second
and evaluate whether it's true or just a misused buzz word placement.
[Thumbnail image courtesy Dan Taylor.]
Â

post.title: Deezer Takes On Spotify With Expansions In Middle East, Africa, Brazil And Asia
post.summary: Deezer, the music streaming service which raised $130 million this fall to expand its business internationally, is today making good on those ambitions with launches in twenty-two new regions across the Middle East, Asia, Africa and Brazil. Included in the rollout are the Republic of Korea, Taiwan and the United Arab Emirates, among others. The company is also touting its claim to fame as the first legal streaming service in the Maghreb region of Africa. Deezer, which now has over 20 million tracks available for streaming across smartphones, PCs, tablets and wireless speakers, has been making several moves in recent months to compete with big names like Spotify in both feature set and international support. In November, the company rolled out a ton of product updates, including an app store called App Studio, which competes with Spotifyâ€™s own App Center, Â as well as new APIs and partnerships with Echonest for music discovery and Songkick for event listings. It also released upgraded mobile apps. At the time, the company announced it had grown to 26 million users across 160 countries, with 2 million paying subscribers. Today, the company maintains that 26 million user figure publicly, but says it has grown its paying subscribers to 3 million across 182 countries. For comparisonâ€™s sake, Spotify has 20 million+ tracks and 20 million+ users across 17 countries, over 5 million of whom are paying subscribers. The new regions included in Deezerâ€™s expansion are: Algeria, Bahrain, Brazil, Egypt, Hong Kong, Iraq, Jordan, Kuwait, Lebanon, Morocco, Oman, Pakistan, Philippines, Qatar, Republic of Korea, Saudi Arabia, South Africa, Taiwan, Tunisia, UAE, Venezuela, and Yemen. Of those, Brazil is an especially important emerging market for Deezer to address, which is why it has now opened its South American headquarters in Sao Paulo. Gaining the first-mover advantage in other regions will also help Deezer compete on the international stage, where users in developing markets have skipped buying PCs, but are coming online via mobile devices in incredible numbers.

post.title: EB: We would have much rather preferred to be a part of Warped Tour as opposed to headlining.Â Headl
post.summary: Substream Music Press: You guys released your second EP Hope a few months back. This is part two in a three part EP trilogy, the first EP being called Hate . You've said the third EP is still untitled but what is HH trying to say with these three releases? Eron Bucciarelli: I don't want to give anything away about the third EP, so I'll tell you what the first two albums were about and let the reader make their own guesses and inferences on the subject matter for the third album.Â Hate was about letting out all of the frustrations and anger that built up inside us over the last few years from dealing with the death of our best friend to all of the lawsuits and ultimately bankruptcy.Â Hope is about trying to stay positive through adversity and not letting the negative experiences in your life consume you. SMP: HH seems like a perfect band to have been on Warped this past summer, since it was a tour made up primarily discount car rentals in phoenix arizona of your peer class who were breaking around the same time as you. Was a headlining tour more of a priority discount car rentals in phoenix arizona at this summer? EB: We would have much rather preferred discount car rentals in phoenix arizona to be a part of Warped Tour as opposed to headlining.Â Headlining is very tough when you're competing with Warped Tour.Â We normally try to avoid touring in the US during the summer because of this.Â If it were solely our decision, we would have done Warped, but alas, its Kevin Lyman's decision. ( This interview was conducted in late 2012. Hawthorne Heights have since been confirmed to play Warped 2013) SMP: When we spoke in Portland in late June, you mentioned that you feel like you may have lost some credibility in your career along the way. Can you explain why you think fans may have dropped off? EB: I may have misspoken when we talked.Â I don't think we've lost credibility at all.Â We've certainly lost mainstream media attention and we severely lack the marketing dollars we once had behind us which enabled us to maintain a much higher level of success.Â We still have a substantial following (nearly 500k on Facebook for example and hundreds discount car rentals in phoenix arizona of thousands of plays on Spotify).Â Has our ability to draw thousands discount car rentals in phoenix arizona of people discount car rentals in phoenix arizona diminished over the last few years? Absolutely.Â Some of that is due to people's musical tastes changing as they grow up and some of that is due to not having a label drop millions of dollars in promotion on our releases and tours. EB: During the summer of 2006 we committed to filing a lawsuit against Victory Records.Â That fall we headlined the Nintendo Fusion, which was by far our biggest headlining tour we had done.Â Some nights discount car rentals in phoenix arizona were over 5000 people.Â If Only You Were Lonely came out six months prior to the tour and had sold nearly 500k copies.Â It was on-track to surpass sales of Silence In Black And White in half the time.Â We were flying high and momentum was building rapidly.Â We rode that success through Warped Tour 2007.Â It really wasn't until after Casey passed away that fall and we were consumed with grief and legal bullshit discount car rentals in phoenix arizona that we even noticed any type of slowing in momentum.Â It was like being hit by a brick wall.Â When we started playing shows again after Fragile Future came out, it wasn't the same from a performance standpoint and crowd size standpoint.Â I feel the biggest reason for that was not being heavily advertised for nearly a year and a half.Â That's a lifetime for a band to be out of the ADHD generation's eye.Â We released Fragile Future in 2008, but Victory wasn't really invested in promoting it as heavily as our past two releases because it was our last for the label.Â We signed to Wind Up and sat without promotion for another two years as we wrote Skeletons , all the while our management told us that those two years wouldn't matter once Wind Up started their promotional machine.Â We knew we were losing momentum, discount car rentals in phoenix arizona but our hands were tied and that made it all that more excruciating. EB: I don't think you can try to stay relevant.Â In fact, when you try, ironically it has the opposite effect in my experience.Â discount car rentals in phoenix arizona We've tried to get back to writing music from the heart, the way we want and without outside influences.Â discount car rentals in phoenix arizona I think fans realize what we do is genuine and not some sort of gimmick designed to cash in for a moment in time.Â Â That fact has kept us relevant. SMP: Obviously, you had your struggles with Victory Records back in the day as well. That was a huge story at the time. Looking back now, seeing where your band is today, have your views changed at all on that situation? EB: As time passed and we grew up, our perspective on our legal issues with Victory has certainly changed.Â Looking back, some of the issues we had with Victory discount car rentals in phoenix arizona were childish.Â Without getting into specifics, our new perspective doesn't change everything about that situation.Â We learned a great deal from that experience, enough to say that we would have never engaged in a lawsuit had we known then what we know now.Â Lawsuits are wars of attrition.Â You win by wearing your opponent down, not by being right.Â The notion that our courts are set up to attain justice is a misnomer.Â You can prove just about any position if you have the time and money.Â Â Those resources are in limited supply if you're a band.Â Â We were childish to think we could assert ourselves in court.Â Furthermore, we had issues with Tony in the same way a teenager has issues with their parents.Â discount car rentals in phoenix arizona We were acting out and being defiant.Â We should have sought an amicable outcome PRIOR to filing a lawsuit.Â That was our biggest mistake. SMP: It's pretty rare to see a band with your career, hits, solid records and nonstop touring discount car rentals in phoenix arizona quit the label game and go completely DIY. How has this decision benefitted the band both as a business and as individual musicians? What hardships have been the most difficult to adjust to? EB: Over the course of our career, we've soaked up every piece of music industry discount car rentals in phoenix arizona knowledge we could, both good and bad.Â When it came time for us to make the decision to re-sign discount car rentals in phoenix arizona versus discount car rentals in phoenix arizona go it alone, we weighed the pros and cons and felt we could do better on our own as opposed to re-signing into a particular situation we felt wasn't going to do anything for our career.Â We're not opposed to being on a label at all.Â We simply felt doing things ourselves was better at the time than the alternative.Â From a creative standpoint it was been re-invigorating.Â We have a newfound sense of joy while writing and recording.Â From a business standpoint, we can do whatever it is WE want and we don't have to wait two weeks for a label to answer our question and inevitably tell us no, for no other reason than someone else has never done what we're attempting discount car rentals in phoenix arizona to do and therefore makes it too risky for them.Â If we want to co-release a vinyl version of our album with another label or write a 100+ page book about the writing process to include in our pre-sales, we can do it and make it happen more efficiently than most labels out there.Â The one and only hardship has been not having a substantial marketing budget discount car rentals in phoenix arizona to effectively promote our releases as our first two albums were promoted. SMP: You mentioned some plans you may have for next year and even into 2014. When you do feel discouraged by the size of crowds discount car rentals in phoenix arizona or people not being aware that you've put a new record out, what keeps you moving forward? discount car rentals in phoenix arizona EB: If a particular show tanks, I try to find out why so we can avoid that from happening in the future.Â Sometimes "promoters" simply don't promoteâ€¦which sounds discount car rentals in phoenix arizona odd given their title, but you'd be surprised at how many "promoters" discount car rentals in phoenix arizona are simply discount car rentals in phoenix arizona talent buyers and all aspects of promotion and advertising are lost on them.Â Sometimes there's a mitigating factor beyond our control, in which case that show was doomed from the start.Â Sometimes it's our fault for not doing everything on our end.Â No matter how big your tour is or how much promotion you have, sometimes you have bad shows.Â There are always a few duds on EVERY tour.Â For example, on Nintendo Fusion, we did 2-3,000 people on average, 5,000 people in Denver and maybe 300 in Seattle.Â We've come to accept this phenomenon.Â We still get stopped on the street in Tokyo for pictures or recognized by our waiter at Denny's in Ft Lauderdale.Â We still have a massive following and understand that there is a difference between people knowing us and knowing of our show that night.Â discount car rentals in phoenix arizona The only way to maximize discount car rentals in phoenix arizona the amount of people at a show and minimize the amount of people who miss our show that know (and like) our band in that given market is through sheer marketing dollars.Â We have years of poor advertising to overcome and we only have ourselves to blame for that. EB: We're going to continue to release discount car rentals in phoenix arizona music beyond the third EP, but I simply don't know what format that will take at the moment.Â Besides music, we're putting an emphasis on touring abroad; hitting places we haven't been in years or have never been.

post.title: It's been a little while....
post.summary: The more and more I do in Spain, the harder it seems to become to write about it all....So here's a little bit of what I've been up to: Look at all that beautiful ham and cheese! Christmas Eve Dinner (Nochebuena): I went to my friend's house and ate and sang and danced until about 4am. Â :D Christmas Day I headed to Carlos Heredia's house for some more dancing and singing and eating.Â Nothing better than a fire and some flamenco!Â I headed to Madrid a couple weeks ago to put together a piece with fellow Fulbrighter and tap dancer Alexander MacDonald that will be performed in Germany at the Fulbright Seminar there. Â I don't want to post the video so as not to spoil anything ;) Â ...but I'm pretty happy with what we put together, it's an interesting dialogue between flamenco and tap. Â Here we are after rehearsal in Madrid.Â My new year's resolution has been to travel more around AndalucÃ­a. Â Last weekend I went to Carmona, Â which is just outside Sevilla, and is one of the oldest urban sites in Europe. Â A Phoenician vase. A picture of the menu of various sweets you can order from the Convent of Santa Clara, which is particularly famous for its yemas--sweets made with egg yolks. Â A photo of the Roman necropolis in Carmona. Â So cool! My impatience and Sevici: Sevici is a bike system that I use to get around in Sevilla. Â Basically, you buy a year long pass for about 30 euros, and you can take out a bike from any Sevici station around the city, and as long as you return it within half an hour it's free. Â After that I think it's about a euro an hour. Â A few weeks ago, I go to take out a bike, and the screen says I have a debt of fifty something euros! I couldn't believe this--I *almost* always make sure the bike is parked well (it beeps twice if it is after you return it). Â For several days, I called, Sevici, I went to the Sevici office, I sent email requests to Sevici, and they said a technician would go to the station I returned the bike to and see if it was my error or their error. Â And they said that would take one day. Â Yeah, well, after about a week and a half with no bike and no response, I decided I would pay the stupid debt, because I really need a bike. Â Well, of course a few hours after I decided to do that, I get an email saying that the debt was an error of Sevici's and they removed the debt. Â So then I had a useless 50 euro credit on my account. Argh! I simply don't have patience like the Spaniards, but I'm getting better.....Anyways, lucky for me Sevici took the 50 euro credit off and transferred the money to my bank account....but really, I need a little more patience to live here. Â And last but not least, what I've been doing with most of my time: I've been reading this book. Â But not just reading it. Â I'm looking up everything in it I don't know, every name that is mentioned and not explained. Â I listen to every singer and song that is mentioned (hooray for Spotify!) Â This is a book that I have been meaning to read for a long time, and I think I just wasn't quite ready to read it. Â The author, Ãngel Ãlvarez Caballero, assumes the reader already knows a significant amount about the cante, and I am finally to the point where I know enough to really delve into this book which is a dense history of flamenco singing. Â The history of the cante is so essential to understanding flamenco; everything comes from the cante. Â I think that as a flamenco, it's essential that I have a deep understanding of the singing, since that is the base for the dancing. Â And I've been listening. Â Repetition seems to be the key to everything. Â Listening to a song once just doesn't cut it. Â I listen over and over to whatever song I happen to be studying. Â It's the same in dancing--it's only once you've repeated something over and over with consciousness and awareness that you are able to understand and learn. Â And I have a LOT to learn about flamenco. Â The more I learn, the more I realize I lack, which inspires me to study even more. Â Flamenco is so profound, full of so many corners to discover and decode!

post.title: Qu4rt Primera | Cierra los ojos y dÃ©jate llevar
post.summary: Pere JouÂ es quien se encuentra trasÂ Qu4rt Primera. QuizÃ¡s los mÃ¡s espabilados sabrÃ¡n que Ã©l fue el encargado de los teclados durante parte de la gira de La Ciudad SubterrÃ¡neaÂ de Dorian. AdemÃ¡s apareciÃ³ mencionadoÂ en la entrevista con el grupo que les hice hace unos aÃ±os. Qu4rt Primera es una banda de pop folk en catalÃ que publicÃ³ el aÃ±o pasado el discoÂ PelÂ·lÃ­culesÂ (Satelite K, 2012), el segundo tras dos aÃ±os desde su debutÂ El MÃ³n en un cafÃ¨Â (2010). PelÂ·lÃ­cules comienza a lo grande: con casi siete minutos de canciÃ³n, Una Estranya SituaciÃ³, que es el tema mÃ¡s largo de todo el disco y quizÃ¡s el mÃ¡s denso. El pop folk se nota todavÃ­a mÃ¡s en Bellesa Assessina, aunque va derivando por mÃ¡s estilos musicales como un pop mÃ¡s electrÃ³nico a lo Moby como en la hipnÃ³tica Cada Moviment. Ã‰staÂ sigue con esa manera de captar la atenciÃ³n acompaÃ±ado por los sonidos del mar y de un piano que envuelven toda la melodÃ­a, en Caminem Junts, los toques mÃ¡s acelerados vienen de temas como Per quÃ¨ no deixarÃ s de tenir por?. La presentaciÃ³n del disco se hizo con El Teu AmantÂ (VÃ­deo: Idea original de Rafa Roses)Â que combina elementos de varios estilos que se entremezclan en el disco, con un punto ademÃ¡s Ã©pico. TambiÃ©n tiene una canciÃ³n con nombre de un paÃ­s muy musical, SuÃ¨cia, donde parece resonar toda una orquesta de fondo, dando una gran inmensidad a la canciÃ³n. Varias de sus canciones incluyen fragmentos de diÃ¡logos de pelÃ­culas, quizÃ¡s sean guiÃ±os personales por parte de Pere o tengan algÃºn sentido mayor a las canciones, pero que vuelven a demostrar la uniÃ³n que siempre he pensado que existe entre cine y mÃºsica, en general entre todo el arte. Tienen una delicadeza digna de canciones de Pastora pero con unas melodÃ­as que apuntan mÃ¡s al pop que nos ofrecen M83 combinado a su vez con folk patrio. A estas tres bandas se le une una voz personal que transmite sentimiento. En conclusiÃ³n es un disco que quiero comprarme, quiero poner en mi colecciÃ³n de discos y darle mil escuchas. Porque tienen un "algo" bonito, elegante y diferente. Qu4rt Primera rules! Uno este grupo al de Gerard Civat i els Civets de los que me gustarÃ­a ver en concierto en una prÃ³xima visita a tierras catalanas, porque siempre vuelvo y me encantarÃ­a regresar a encontrarme conciertos asÃ­. Sigo explorando la mÃºsica en catalÃ asÃ­ que si tenÃ©is sugerencias me las podÃ©is dejar en esta lista compartida que tengo por Spotify, todas las canciones son bienvenidas Â¡Dejadme vuestras sugerencias! Esta recomendaciÃ³n me la hizoÂ Seis grados bajo cero, Ã©xito asegurado.

post.title: Jonathan Warren and The Billy Goats
post.summary: Lugging the sound ofÂ Appalachian around like a travel worn tattered old suitcase plastered with travel stickers, containing the basic necessities a traveler needs to keep thier roots close, and ample space for things collected through weary wanderings, Jonathan Warren and The Billy Goats build on those roots of mountian music with a cross section ofÂ influences for a sound they rightly callÂ â€œprogressive psychobilly folk grassâ€ with a bit of Gypsy and Vaudevillian stylings, you know my dear readers this gets right in my Boxcar for the long haul. Now Boise, Idaho-based Jonathan Warren and The Billy Goats released A Little Something Stronger Than Wine (Amazon MP3 & Spotify) in 2011, their second album give a listen to the Reverbnation widget below the videos, and get it! They recently released two videos that feature two songs off of their forthcoming album, look to the vast western skies for it's arrival this Spring! \ Free Electronic Press Kits template from ReverbNation.com

post.title: Gov Ball Haul
post.summary: As you could probably tell from myÂ Fall Freak Out, I love lists, I love countdowns, I love forcing myself to do something and then documenting it. And so, I bring you my Gov. Ball Haul. The Governors Ball is just 129 days away (click hereÂ for tickets) and I need to start applying sunscreen now (Polish people donâ€™t burn, we ignite) and scientifically structuring my line-up. The best thing about these festivals is the opportunity to hear new music. Iâ€™m constantly striving to update my Spotify playlist and keep myself young and relevant. One day I might have kids or nieces who are going to giggle behind my back because I donâ€™t know anything (I had an Aunt I had to introduce to Britney Spears back in the dayâ€¦). Iâ€™ll always have my favorites but if I love music as much as I say I do, itâ€™s important to keep up with whatâ€™s happening. And thereâ€™s no better time than a festival, especially Governorâ€™s Ball which has carefully vetted a kick-ass list of headliners and heavy hitters: Kanye West, Kings of Leon, Azealia Banks, The xx, and Kendrick Lamar, to name a few. And so, in my effort to stay educated, Iâ€™m going to help you out. Once a week until the festival (thatâ€™s called dedication, people) Iâ€™ll be listening to the guys just a further bit down the list from Sir Kanye, and filling you in on all the details. This way, youâ€™ll be super educated to build that amazing line-up AND you didnâ€™t even need to lift an earbud. Stay Tuned.

post.title: Bear Vs. Shark: Catamaran
post.summary: I discovered Bear vs. Shark by accident. A college roommate had insisted I listen to Minus the Bear, and I wasnâ€™t paying attention, so only the â€œBearâ€ part stuck. It proved to be a serendipitous little mistake though, because Bear vs. Shark is as awesome as the battle portrayed in their name would be. â€œCatamaranâ€ is a particularly good example of Bear vs. Sharkâ€™s wilder side. The lead single off their second (and last) album Terrorhawk (another name that bleeds awesomeness), Catamaran is a frantic, manic song about, like, dancing? Or something about supermarkets? Thereâ€™s something about â€œdirty wordsâ€ in there. Whatever, itâ€™s not important; like many of their songs (and many of the songs I like), the lyrics are pretty much word-salad. Unlike the meaning, the energy is crystal clear, complete with those machine-gun, rat-a-tat-tat-tat muted strums, vocals like a pinball stuck between octave bumpers, and some hardcore maracas. Not to mention one of the best shouting voices I think Iâ€™ve ever heard. The whole albums is worth a listen, as well as their debut, Right Now, Youâ€™re in the Best of Hands. And If Something Isnâ€™t Quite Right, Your Doctor Will Know in a Hurry. Spotify, Amazon, iTunes

post.title: Nokia Music+ Offers Premium Streaming for Half the Going Rate, If Youâ€™ve Got a Lumia
post.summary: Nokia launched its free, ad-free, Lumia-exclusive, and pretty sweet streaming music service â€œNokia Musicâ€ in September of last year, and now itâ€™s upping the ante with a moderately priced paid version that comes with all the fixinâ€™s. Nokia Music+ is pretty much like your paid versions of services like Spotify, but at just $3.99/â‚¬3.99 (varying slightly based on territory), it beats most of its competitors on price. If you pick up the premium version of the service, youâ€™ll get higher audio quality, unlimited skips in radio-mode, lyrics, a desktop player, and last but not least, as many songs as you can download and fit on your colorful little handset for offline play. The service is still playlist-based, so you can pick and choose your tracks, but the curation can prove to be a bonus, and at half the standard going rate of premium music services, itâ€™s a pretty good deal. Nokia has yet to announce what countries itâ€™s going to bring the new service to or when itâ€™s rolling out, but hereâ€™s to hoping weâ€™re on the list. Nokia via ZDNet

Representante de U2 acusa a Google de "hacer dinero" con piraterÃ­a El representante de U2 y PJ Harvey, Paul McGuiness, ha dicho hoy que "existe la sensaciÃ³n de que Google no hace todo lo que puede" contra la piraterÃ­a y ha ido mÃ¡s allÃ¡ al acusar a los responsables del buscador de internet de "hacer dinero" gracias a sus enlaces hacia contenidos ilegales. "Google le ha dado mucho a la civilizaciÃ³n en tÃ©rminos de conocimiento, son ingeniosos, pero estÃ¡n haciendo dinero redirigiendo al pÃºblico hacia pÃ¡ginas que contienen piraterÃ­a", ha dicho el portavoz de la cÃ©lebre banda durante su participaciÃ³n hoy en una charla del Mercado Internacional del Disco y la EdiciÃ³n Digital (MIDEM) en Cannes (Francia). Ha sido en el mismo foro donde hace un aÃ±o exacto el propio McGuiness acusÃ³ a Google de no hacer nada para desincentivar ese tipo de resultados en sus bÃºsquedas. "Me gustarÃ­a ver algo de acciÃ³n por su parte", ha aÃ±adido hoy. Entonces desconfiÃ³ tambiÃ©n de la intervenciÃ³n de los polÃ­ticos, temerosos de aplicar medidas por el riesgo a resultar "impopulares", aunque hoy se ha sentado junto al comisario europeo de Mercado Interior y Servicios, Michel Barnier, para discutir sobre el diÃ¡logo emprendido por Bruselas en el Ã¡mbito de los derechos de autor. "Celebro mucho esta iniciativa", ha dicho McGuiness, que ha insistido en que, pese al crecimiento de los servicios legales de suscripciÃ³n musical como Spotify o Deezer, Ã©stos no representan de momento mÃ¡s que un medio "puramente promocional" incluso para una gran banda como U2 y que "Google sigue siendo el gran distribuidor". Barnier, por su parte, ha apostado por estudiar la forma de garantizar el acceso de todos los europeos por igual a servicios y contenidos digitales legales, independientemente del territorio, coordinando las distintas leyes reguladoras sobre patentes y derechos de autor.

post.title: KUNZEN, Friedrich Ludwig Ã†milius (1761-1817) - The Hallelujah of Creation
post.summary: El JardÃ­ de les DelÃ­cies, obra d'Hieronymus Bosch "El Bosco" (1450-1516), pintor holandÃ¨s. Friedrich Ludwig Ã†milius Kunzen (1761-1817) compositor i organista alemany nascut a LÃ¼beck. Comencem setmana amb la ressaca festera de la celebraciÃ³ mozartiana i ho farem amb la potÃ¨ncia i el descobriment d'un germÃ nic emigrat, i feliÃ§ment adoptat, a Dinamarca. Kunzen, de qui coneixia fugaÃ§ment una de les seves referÃ¨ncies simfÃ²niques grÃ cies a la labor i a l'excelÂ·lÃ¨ncia dels bons amics del segell CPO, ha resultat ser un impressionant descobriment grÃ cies, principalment, a la monumental obra que avui presentarÃ©. Kunzen va nÃ©ixer a Alemanya tot i que, com comentava, rÃ pidament emigraria a Dinamarca. Inicialment, Kunzen temptaria sort amb la ciÃ¨ncia jurÃ­dica tot i que plÃ cidament observaria que la jurisprudÃ¨ncia no seria el seu fort cosa que el faria decantar-se per la mÃºsica grÃ cies, tambÃ©, a l'assessorament i a l'ajuda del seu contemporani alemany i compositorÂ Johann Abraham Peter Schulz (de qui un bon dia tambÃ© en parlarÃ©). AmbdÃ³s, potser motivats per la ferotge competÃ¨ncia artÃ­stica d'una Alemanya saturada d'extraordinaris mÃºsics, decidirien emigrar a Copenhaguen on, satisfactÃ²riament, assolirien l'Ã¨xit i el reconeixement tot i que, pels anals de la histÃ²ria, han quedat absolutament relegats i en la foscor de la saviesa musical popular. Una de les peculiaritats i que avui ens podrien resultar sorprenents de l'univers danÃ¨s, va ser que Kunzen, admirador i amant de la mÃºsica de Mozart, intentaria traslladar l'art de l'austrÃ­ac als simpÃ tics danesos amb la convicciÃ³, aparentment evident, que aquesta seria rebuda amb entusiasme i aplaudiments. La realitat, per sorprenent que pugui semblar, no va ser aixÃ­ i, per exemple, la representaciÃ³ de Cosi Fan Tutte, l'any 1798, fou un fracÃ s absolut. PotserÂ d'aquÃ­Â uns centenars d'anys algunes mÃºsiques infumables de la postmodernitat resultaran atractives i gratificants...Â Avui, en qualsevol cas, recuperarem una partitura lÃ­rica i coral de Kunzen. De fet, Ã©s una obra que ens remet directament a La CreaciÃ³ de HaydnÂ (si bÃ© la de Kunzen fou estrenada amb anterioritat a la de Haydn) i que rep per tÃ­tol, anÃ logament a aquesta, l'Aleluia de la CreaciÃ³ per a cor, solistes i orquestra. Del llibretista i poeta danÃ¨sÂ Jens Immanuel Baggesen, Kunzen la va escriure i estrenar l'any 1797 i la va publicar l'any 1804. De carÃ cter solemne i melodramÃ tic, Ã©s un himne majestuÃ³s a la vida i als seus encants en quÃ¨ s'alternen parts solistes, recitatius i grans cors. Si bÃ© la interpretaciÃ³ Ã©s exigent i requereix d'un estudi voluntariÃ³s i meticulÃ³s, la posada en escena d'aquest oratori, molt popular a Alemanya fins a meitat del segle XIX, Ã©s prou satisfactÃ²ria tot i que sensiblement millorable. I en honor i seguint amb la inÃ¨rcia de l'aniversari de Mozart, l'oratori l'introduirÃ© amb una Obertura sobre un tema de Mozart, queÂ Ã²bviament, segueix el fidel camÃ­ musical del geni austrÃ­ac. Un bon dilluns de gener, de temps plÃ cid i de fred moderat ens permet encarar la setmana amb optimisme tot i el constant bombardeig de notÃ­cies negatives del nostre entorn. Com sempre dic, la mÃºsica Ã©s una de les millors medicines per tal d'afrontar amb energia, amb salut i amb un somriure aquest context advers i dramÃ tic. Kunzen, amb aquesta oda a la creaciÃ³ ens ajudarÃ a valorar, tot i el dramatisme romÃ ntic i poÃ¨tic amb quÃ¨ se'ns presenta, l'existÃ¨ncia d'una forma mÃ©s transparent i genuÃ¯na perquÃ¨ la mÃºsica, acompanyada de la paraula sincera i de la bona voluntat, Ã©s una font de virtut i de bondat. AixÃ­ sigui ja que per cert, hem de celebrar a Kunzen ja que avui, precisament, se'n commemora el 196Ã¨ aniversari de la seva mort... per tu, allÃ on siguis, amÃ©n! La representaciÃ³ a cÃ rrec de la Danish National Radio Choir, la Danish National Radio Symphony Orchestra sota la direcciÃ³ de Peter Marschik. Gaudiu i compartiu! post.title: Losers strike back: Nokia challenge Spotify and BlackBerry unveil new phone
post.summary: Today, it is the Revenge of the Losers. First up, Nokia who are hoping to win people over that were last in love with the company when they made Snake II, with a new music service. Nokia Music+ is a subscription-based service which is very similar to the hugely popular Spotify (which just so happens to be unavailable for Windows Phone users). Nokia customers will be able to download unlimited mixes for offline playback, listen to tracks with unlimited track skips, have the option to select higher quality audio when connecting via Wi-Fi and stream lyrics. However, the big difference is that Nokia Music+ will cost just Â£3.99 a month (Spotify Premium is around a tenner). â€œBy removing barriers like adverts and sign-ins, Nokia Music makes it easy for users to discover and enjoy music on the go. Nokia Music+ now provides increased control over the listening experience at half the cost of many third party services,â€ said Jyrki Rosenberg, VP for Entertainment at Nokia. Nokia Music+ will be available to Nokia Lumia owners as a paid update and will roll out very soon. Elsewhere, BlackBerry are looking to crawl back into our affections, as Research In Motion (RIM) look to put their huge global operating losses behind them and unveil new phones on Wednesday. One phone will feature the classic BB keyboard, while the other will have a touchscreen. Both handsets will showcase the new BB10 software, according to reports. If it fails, it looks like BlackBerry could disappear forever. If they are to succeed, analysts think that RIM will need to win back the corporate customers that used BBs so extensively. As for Nokia? Will this be the thing that helps them to rival Samsung and Apple? Itâ€™s not exactly offering anything new is it?

post.title: Samsung wants to offer Music Hub streaming service on non-Samsung phones, tablets
post.summary:
Samsungâ€™s Music Hub is a music streaming and discovery service which, among other things, can look at the music on your mobile device and create custom playlists from music you donâ€™t own based on your tastes. You can also upload your music to the cloud and listen to it across multiple devices (such as your PC or your phone). Right now the only devices that support Music Hub in the US are the Samsung Galaxy S III and Galaxy Note II smartphones, but the company plans to roll out Music Hub for additional Samsung devicesâ€¦ and according to The Next Web, Samsung is also hoping to offer the service eventually for productsÂ notÂ made by Samsung.
While Samsung is one of the top makers of Android phones and tablets, there are still an awful lot of folks using devices built by Asus, HTC, Motorola, LG, and other competitors. Offering Music Hub as an app that isnâ€™t tied to a single manufacturer could be a way to pick up some extra revenue and build a stronger brand for Samsungâ€™s software as well as its hardware. On the other hand, while Samsung Hub (which is basically what the company rebranded mSpot after buying that company) has a few unique tricks up its sleeve, it will have to compete with popular music services such as Spotify, Rdio, Pandora, and Rhapsody. Iâ€™m not exactly sure why someone who buys an DROID DNA would feel the need to use Samsungâ€™s streaming music app. Samsung wants to offer Music Hub streaming service on non-Samsung phones, tablets is a post from: Liliputing

post.title: Snakeberry: Webradio mit Raspberry Pi und Android-App
post.summary:
Es ist ein Weilchen her, da habe ich mir mal zum Spielen einen Raspberry Pi zugelegt und euch vorgestellt. Dieser kleine aber gÃ¼nstige Computer hat mir schnell gezeigt, dass ich weder die Zeit noch den Nerv habe mich mit ihm auseinander zu setzen. Ambitionen waren freilich da, aber manchmal mangelt es mir an Konstanz und KnowHow. Ganz anders ist da der Entwickler Bruno Hautzenberger. Bruno hat sich ebenfalls einen Pi zugelegt und damit ein kleines Projekt gestartet und auch vollendet, welches ich euch hier heute vorstelle. Das ganze hÃ¶rt auf den Namen â€œSnakeberryâ€ und macht aus eurem Raspberry Pi ein Webradio. Damit das ganze auch noch bequem zu managen geht, hat der Bruno auch direkt noch eine Android-App dazu programmiert, Ã¼ber welchen ihr den Webradio-Dienst auf eurem Pi steuern kÃ¶nnt.
Die App kommt ganz ohne Konfiguration aus und erkennt alle Snakeberryâ€™s in eurem Netzwerk. Doch nicht nur diverse Webradios kÃ¶nnt ihr wiedergeben lassen, sondern der Pi bekommt mit Snakeberry in naher Zukunft auch eine Spotify-Anbindung. ZusÃ¤tzlich stellt Bruno fÃ¼r seinen Webservice auch die passende API zur VerfÃ¼gung, damit der geneigte Entwickler auch auf jeder anderen Plattform eine Fernbedienungs-App schreiben kann. Wer diesen tollen Dienst nutzen mÃ¶chte, der braucht einen Raspberry Pi mit einer entsprechend installierten Distribution, den Snakeberry Dienst und wie bereits beschrieben die Android-App dazu. KÃ¼nftig stehen auch noch weitere Ideen auf der Liste des Entwicklers wie zum Beispiel DLNA-Integration und die UnterstÃ¼tzung fÃ¼r Protokolle wie Airplay. AuÃŸerdem soll es eine Integration von Podcasts oder Streams geben.
Damit wird Snakeberry zu einem kompletten Beschallungsserver fÃ¼r kleinstes Geld, denn der Raspberry Pi dazu kostet je nach Ausstattung rund 50 Euro. Wer mehr darÃ¼ber erfahren mÃ¶chte, sollte sich den Artikel von BrunoÂ oder das entsprechende WikiÂ anschauen. In diesem findet ihr alles, was es braucht um aus eurem Pi ein Snakeberry zu machen. AuÃŸerdem ist die Grundidee des Snakeberry auch, ein offenes Ende zu haben. Das bedeutet, dass jeder der mÃ¶chte weitere Services in Snakeberry integrieren kann und den Player somit um weitere Features bereichern kann. Damit ihr einen Eindruck davon bekommt, wie sich das ganze gestaltet, empfehle ich euch noch folgendes Video dazu.

post.title: Stream Millions of Free Songs with HypedMusic on iOS
post.summary: Looking for a free, legal and advertisement-free way to stream your favorite music on the iPhone or iPod touch? HypedMusic version 1.0 provides just that, with a simple interface that can be synced using a Facebook account (or not). The app makes it possible to create playlists of your favorite tracks.You will have to know exactly what you're looking for, since there's no way to browse for artists or songs. Search results are sourced from all over the web, and although sometimes a music server might not work well, available songs play just fine for the most part. Like other music apps,HypedMusicÂ will play your tunes while running in the background.Logging in with your Facebook account will sync playlists automatically, so you can listen to your tracks on a computer through the hypedmusic.com website. There's no limit to the number of songs or number of hours you can listen to music accessed by the HypedMusic app. According to the developer, Luke Li there are many improvements coming to future versions of the utility. This includes album browsing, radio stations, trending songs and social media integration.The HypedMusic service has already been operating for two years, and now iOS users can enjoy the benefits of this project. Although services such as Pandora, Spotify or Rdio may offer tracks that can't be found on HypedMusic, having access to these without advertisements means a subscription cost. HypedMusic can be installed on iOS 5.0 and later running on devices including the iPhone 3GS and later, or iPod touch 3G and later.

post.title: POLLO CON LANGOSTINO
post.summary: Oggi a casa Masquefa si cucina pollo con i gamberi. E` da tanto ormai che Blanca mi parla di questa ricetta dicendomi sempre che dovrei provarla. Una delle tante storie che mi racconta sempre Ã¨ proprio questa: il mitico pollo con langostino di Oscar, una rivisitazione dell'amico cuoco di una ricetta tipica della cataluÃ±a. Come prima cosa c'Ã¨ da dire che non sono del tutto sicura che la carne con il pesce mi piaccia. Si lo so, in cucina il mare e montagna non Ã¨ una novitÃ perÃ² nella mia testa tutto ciÃ² non ha mai funzionato (non Ã¨ carne, non Ã¨ pesce, sa soltanto quello che non Ã¨..).La ricetta prevede moltissimi ingredienti: acciughe, zafferano, nocciole, cioccolato, alloro, aglio, cipolla, brandy, vino bianco, pomodori, biscotti secchi e chiaramente il pollo ed i gamberi.Questa lista all'inizio mi disorienta; mi sembrano tanti sapori diversi tra loro che non ho idea di che risultato possano dare mescolati. Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â Hoy en casa Masquefa se cocina pollo con langostinos.Ya es mucho tiempo que Blanca me va contanto de esta receta y me dice siempre que tendrÃ­a que probarla. Una de las muchas historias que me cuenta es justo esta: el mitico pollo con langostino de Oscar, una revisitaciÃ³n de su amigo cocinero de una receta tÃ­pica de cataluÃ±a.Por primera cosa tengo que decir que no estoy completamente segura che la carne con el pescado me guste. Si lo se, en la cocina el mar y montaÃ±a no es una novedad pero en mi cabeza esto siempre me pareciÃ³ un abinamento muy raro.La receta prevee muchisimos ingredientes: anchoas, azafran, avellanas, ciocolate, laurel, ajo, cebolla, brandy, vino blanco, tomates rallados, galletas maria, y obviamente pollo y langostinos.Este listado no os parece muuuy vario? AsÃ­ tanto que al principio me desorienta un poco. No tengo idea de que resultado puedan dar todos mescolados entre ellos. Avvio su spotify la super top traks di Talita, perchÃ© la buona musica per cucinare serve sempre, ed inizio a tritare la cipolla. Io adoro tritare la cipolla, sembrerÃ una cosa stupida perÃ² amo sminuzzare qualsiasi cosa con un buon coltello (sarÃ perchÃ© fu una delle prime cose che la mamma mi insegnÃ² a fare per bene nella sua cucina). E poi il profumo della cipolla in cucina Ã¨ il segnale ufficiale che qualcosa di buono sta per essere preparato.Il profumo.. Uno delle ragioni piÃ¹ importanti per le quali cucino. Quando si inizia a sentire il profumo paradisiaco del pollo che rosola nell'olio insaporito dai gamberi cpisco che sto cucinando un pranzo buonissimo. I procedimenti in realtÃ sono tutti molto semplici e la preparazione scorre rapida. Fino a quando arriviamo al momento del flambÃ©. Devo fare un flambÃ©?? e come si fa? Io mica l'ho mai fatto... e poi con i disastri che combino sempre in cucina di sicuro come minimo mi brucio la faccia... E invece no.. In realtÃ anche questo passaggio si rivela molto semplice e rapido (Alice 1- flambÃ© 0 olÃ©).Dopo 30 minuti di cottura del pollo il pranzo Ã¨ pronto. Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â Avio en spotify la super top traks de Talita, porquÃ© la buena mÃºsica para cocinar sirve siempre, y empiezo picando la cebolla. A mi me encanta picar cebollas, puede parecer una tonterÃ­a pero de verdad yo amo picar cualquier cosa con un buen cuchillo ( esto supongo que tiene que ser porque fue una de las primeras cosas que mi mamÃ¡ me enseÃ±Ã³ a hacer biÃ©n en su cocina). Y el parfume de la cebollita en la cocina es siempre la seÃ±al oficial de que algo de muy rico se estÃ¡ preparando.El parfume... Una de las motivaciones mÃ¡s importantes por las cuales yo cocino. Cuando se empieza a oler el paradisiaco parfume del pollo que ROSOLA el el aceite que sabe a langostinos entiendo que saldrÃ¡ una comida super rica.Los procedimientos en la realidad estan todos muy simples y la preparaciÃ³n fluye rapida. Hasta cuando llegamos al momento del flambÃ©. Tengo que F L A M B E A R? Jajajaja y como se hace?Con todos los desastres que hago siemre cocinando seguro que me voy a quemar la cara como minimo..Y en cambio no.. El la realidad tambiÃ©n este pasaje se revela muy simple (Alice1- flambÃ© 0, olÃ©! ).DespuÃ©s de 30 minutos el pollo estÃ¡ listo y la comida tambiÃ©n. Arrivano a casa gli amici e si inizia a bere vino bianco. E`qui che incomincia la mia parte preferita; Ã¨ l'ora di mettersi a tavola e di rilassarsi. . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â Llegan en casa los amigos y se empieza a beber vino.Es aquÃ­ que llega mi parte favorita; es la hora de sentarse a la mesa y relajarse. Il sapore di questo piatto Ã¨ sorprendente. Tutti a tavola rimaniamo senza parole succiando le tete dei amberi come se non esistesse un domani.Il pollo Ã¨ una carne incredibile che con il suo sapore tenue riesce a combinare bene con tutto. Lo zafferano Ã¨ uno dei sapori dominanti e la dolcezza del gambero rende tutto piÃ¹ interessante. Noto con piacere un retrogusto di cioccolato amaro che mi scalda e rende tutto piÃ¹ cremoso. E` veramente tutto perfetto. Questo pranzo Ã¨ un inno al puro piacere. Credo che questo piatto si meriti proprio l'INCREDIBILE del giorno.Il cibo finisce (un momento sempre molto triste..) e non resta altro che riempirsi il bicchiere con dell'altro vino, assaporare la buona compagnia ed iniziare a pensare al piatto della prossima domenica a casa Maquefa. . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â . Â .Â El sabor de este plato nos surprende. Todas nos quedamos sin palabras chupando cabezas de langostino como si no hubiera maÃ±ana.El pollo es una carne increible con su sabor tÃ¡n delicado de poder quedar biÃ©n con todo lo que te apetece. El azafrÃ¡n ed uno de los sabores que predominan y la dolciura del langostino hace que todo sea mÃ¡s interesante. Noto el sabor del chocolate que me calienta un poco y que rende la salsa mÃ¡s cremosa. Todo parece perfecto! Esta comida e un imno al puro plazer. Creo que este plato se merezca profundamente mi cosa INCREIBLE del dÃ­a.La comida se acaba ( un momento siempre muy triste..) y solo nos queda rellenar las copas, seguir bebiendo vino desfrutando de la buena compaÃ±ia,emboracharse un poco y empezar pensando en la receta del proximo domingo en casa Masquefa. Maria, Amanda e Blanca

post.title: Building The Tower Of Babel Through Results And Artistry
post.summary: It's hard to believe that back in 2000, *NSYNC sold an impressive 9.9M albums, while the highest selling artist of 2011 was Adele with 5.8M albums sold'almost half the volume. In the early 2000s file sharing inundated the music business, and the entire industry was affected, resulting in dramatic sales reduction. One of the upsides was the breadth and depth of music that was now available to those who were previously reliant on their local Sam Goody. There was, and still is, a fine line between stealing and curiosity, but as time has gone on and illegal file sharing curtailed, the legacy of the Napster period has been extremely positive for music. Boy bands began to lose their enormous status and true musicians began to emerge. With such a huge range of music readily accessible through stores like iTunes and subscription models such as Spotify, the landscape has changed in tandem with tastes. A new organic, home-cooked wave of acts has materialized, displacing many of the manufactured artists, and paving the way for a new breed of artists who are representative of our times and those ahead. These are primarily acts writing and performing from the soul, yet they are definitely results-minded (often on their own labels) and balancing commercial goals with true artistry. Consider Mumford & Sons'the Brit roots-based phenomenon that has taken the industry by storm over the last 3 years. I firmly believe that their rise would have been impossible around 2000 due to the formulated shackles the music industry had imposed on itself. Their success has been based on a carefully managed results-based approach to selling music through writing 'real' music and creating bonds with an ever-broadening audience. The appeal of their act, and others like Adele, is extraordinary. Their authenticity and credibility of their music is recognized and loved by dedicated fans'from 16 year olds to 60 year olds. As Billboard Magazine recently stated, 'This is a storybook rise for an unlikely act who has proved that results truly count.' Musically, they're not exactly pushing the boundaries. They're essentially the same flavor as Bob Dylan, the Buckleys, and early Wilco'roots-driven with an ability to bring people together united in music and message. But on a relative scale, they've achieved more than most of their predecessors in a shorter period of time. When they got their first break, it was opening for Brit indie band, the Macabees, in the UK in 2007. Brit audiences are notoriously skeptical about opening acts, often preferring the bar to the stalls. But they responded overwhelmingly, enabling the band to play the festival circuit as well as opening for acts associated with the new Brit folk movement such as Laura Marling. Organic to the end, the band financed their own first album 'Sigh No More' to enable them to have creative freedom. Word of mouth, online recommendations and endorsements from credible UK radio presenters helped to spread the word, and brought the band attention in the U.S. But it wasn't a fast ride to fame. The band toured the U.S. relentlessly, conducting 10 separate stateside tours since 2008. Each month the live audience not only grew but also widened as their appeal reached new demographics. 'Sigh No More' entered the Billboard 200 at #127 in February 2010, selling a humble 5,000 records. It has now sold a cumulative 2.5M copies in the U.S. alone and hasn't fallen out of the top 75 on the Billboard 200 since July 2010. The singles 'Sigh No More,' 'Little Lion Man,' and 'The Cave' grew slowly on the radio while the band and the label continued to dig into the results they were achieving, looking for new opportunities on which to build. From college rock stations to festivals like Bonnaroo, to TV appearances on CMT's Crossroads alongside Emmylou Harris, they found the warmest of greetings. Their slow-build strategy has paid off, after scoring two 2011 Grammy nominations (including best new artist), Mumford & Sons notched four more in 2012 and were a focal point of the broadcast. Mumford & Sons were up there in the echelons of not just rock, but of all music worldwide'organic music with commercial sense. Usually the launch of the second album is fraught with concern and doubt. Bands often have years to develop and tweak material for the first album, and then have to deliver the second in a much shorter time. But the band used their intense touring schedule to refine the new tracks, and they listened carefully to the audience reaction. The Mumford & Sons second record, 'Babel,' was released in September 2012, debuting at number one following a performance on The David Letterman Show. Spotify Chief Content Officer Ken Parks stated that 1 out of every 10 U.S. Spotify users played a song from Babel in its first week of release. It has since become the fastest selling album of 2012 in the UK, selling over 158,000 copies in its first week, and was the biggest selling debut of any album in 2012 in the U.S., selling 600,000 copies in its first week, and over a million worldwide. Mumford & Sons have become the proof of the pudding'that commercial success based on a careful results-based strategy can still be rooted in beautifully crafted and uncompromised music. A far cry from the pre-Napster world and its manufactured acts, it's a sign of the future laden with brilliant artists who are musically driven yet marketing-aware and fully tuned into the results of their creativity. It's a win-win for all.

post.title: Classic of the Week: Max Graham â€“ Airtight
post.summary: If youâ€™d had to name anyone with a taste for diversity, itâ€™s Max Graham. The Canadian producer, whoâ€™s moving to Amsterdam this year and has his roots in the UK, has an impressive history in music. And next to his latest masterpieces, such as â€˜Nothing Else Mattersâ€™, â€˜F.Y.C.â€™ and â€˜Sun In The Winterâ€™, heâ€™s also got a bunch of early classics. This time, we go way, way backâ€¦and discover his 2001 classic â€˜Airtightâ€™! In the early years of the millennium, Max infected Canada with the sound of trance and prog, inspired by DJâ€™s such as Paul Oakenfold and Sasha. He soon grew out to be one of the busiest and most booked prog DJâ€™s, with several record labels picking up his talents. In 2001, as his third release ever, he brought the flourishing EDM scene â€˜Airtightâ€™. An instant hit, propelling Max into the international music scene, resulting in a #23 position in the DJ Mag Top 100, ending up on TiÃ«sto legendary â€˜In Search of Sunrise 2â€™ compilation and receiving massive airplay on Pete Tongâ€™s Essential Mix on Radio 1. Itâ€™s dark and deep, but also takes you on a melodic and dreamy ride, incorporating elements of all different genres. â€˜Airtightâ€™ is layered, unfolding its beauty bit by bit. 12 years after its original release, it still works. To celebrate the release of Maxâ€™ latest â€˜Cycles 4â€™ compilation, weâ€™ve dedicated this weekâ€™s Classic of the Week to Max Grahamâ€™s â€˜Airtightâ€™.You find out exactly why, listening to this classic! Check it out on Spotify, in theÂ Trance Top 1000Â !

post.title: [New post] Soundrop turns Facebook pages into an interactive, collaborative MTV
post.summary: Janko Roettgers posted: "The popular Spotify app Soundrop is expanding to Facebook, (s FB) and it's doing so with a bang: Soundrop announced the launch of interactive music video listening rooms on Facebook artist pages Monday. The Norwegian company teamed up with Abba, Public" Respond to this post by replying above this line New post on GigaOM Soundrop turns Facebook pages into an interactive, collaborativeÂ MTV by Janko Roettgers The popular Spotify app Soundrop is expanding to Facebook, (s FB) and it's doing so with a bang: Soundrop announced the launch of interactive music video listening rooms on Facebook artist pages Monday. The Norwegian company teamed up with Abba, Public Enemy, Nick Cave & The Bad Seeds, Hot Chip and a few other popular artists for its launch, allowing Facebook users to enter social listening rooms on the artists' pages, vote for their favorite tracks and tune into a collaborative mix consisting of a nonstop stream of music videos. "No one has done this before, not even Facebook," said Soundrop CEO Inge Andre Sandvik during an interview Friday. Soundrop has been successfully operating these kinds of rooms within the Spotify app: Music fans listened to more than 500 million tracks through the company's Spotify app last year, according to Soundrop. The new Facebook rooms are joined by the hip with Soundrop's Spotify rooms. The new rooms on Facebook are joined by the hip with the Spotify app: Abba's Facebook listening room will play the same songs as the band's room within the Spotify app, and users can vote on a room's playlist on both platforms. "We don't want to build a separate universe," I was told by Sandvik. However, there is one big difference between the two offerings: The Spotify app relies on the music service's catalog. Soundrop's new Facebook rooms on the other hand play music videos from YouTube (s GOOG) and Vevo, which means that users can tune in without the need to pay for a subscription. The offering is also completely free for musicians, and everyone else who is looking to bring some music to his Facebook presence: Any user with a public Facebook page can add a Soundrop room to that page within minutes. That kind of easy set-up, paired with a pretty solid Soundrop experience that allows thousands of listeners to tune into a collaborative mix and chat about the music at the same time apparently impressed representatives from major music labels that got to see the app before its official launch. "They were amazed that we gave this to them," Sandvik recalled. He added that the app will help bands and labels to drive the engagement of ad-supported videos, and also help with marketing by allowing artists to interact with thousands of fans in real-time through DJ sets other online events. Adding Facebook as an additional platform also shows how Soundrop is maturing: The company launched a first Spotify app when Spotify added third-party apps to its desktop client in late 2011. After gaining good traction on Spotify, it completely revamped its architecture from the ground up late last year to add cross-platform capabilities. Sandvik told me that the Facebook roll-out is just a first step on that journey. The end goal was not to launch the same app with the same UI on a bunch of different sites, but to offer unique experiences that are joined in real time by the music people are listening to and voting for. "It's much more exciting to tell different stories," Sandvik said. Image courtesy of Flickr userÂ humbert15. Janko Roettgers | January 28, 2013 at 6:00 am | URL: http://wp.me/p10LZV-2xlN Comment Â Â Â See all comments Unsubscribe or change your email settings at Manage Subscriptions. Trouble clicking? Copy and paste this URL into your browser: http://gigaom.com/2013/01/28/soundrop-facebook-pages/ Thanks for flying with WordPress.com

post.title: Soundrop Goes Beyond Spotify With Listening Rooms And Videos On Facebook, And Coming Soon To A Platform Near You
post.summary: Soundrop, the social â€œlistening roomâ€ service that is similar to Turntable.fm,Â has found a lot of success on the music streaming service Spotify, with 500 million streams of its rooms in its debut year. Now, Oslo, Noway-based Soundrop is taking its growth strategy up a notch: from today, people can also create and embed listening rooms in Facebook, too. The Facebook service will let peopleÂ embed existing playroomsÂ on to Pages â€” specifically fan pages â€” on Facebook. There, people can add a mixture of audio tracks (from Spotify) and videos (from YouTube and Vevo), and then interact with each other on the page while in the room together. Artists that have signed on early to use the Soundrop Facebook feature include Matisyahu, Delphic, MC Lars, Owl City, Dan Deacon, Devlin, Nick Cave, Franz Ferdinand,Â Hot Chip,Â ABBA, Public Enemy and Greg Dulli from the Afghan Whigs. For now, you cannot create a room on Facebook and embed it on Spotify, although that seems to be the plan longer term as the service continues to grow. At the bottom of this post are two screenshots of how the two different playrooms on Spotify and now Facebook look compared to each other. Facebook is a first in a couple of ways here: it is the first third-party platform outside of Spotify where users can consume Soundropâ€™s service; and it is the first time that Soundrop has incorporated videos into the experience â€” in this case, using content from YouTube and Vevo to do it. This, of course, helps also increase engagement on Facebook â€” a much-coveted metric for the social network as it continues to ramp up its advertising and other revenue-generating strategies. â€œThe Facebook app is a step up for us toÂ add more pixels to the big picture,â€ Inge Sandvik, co-founder and CEO of Soundrop, told me in a Skype interview from the Midem music conference in France. But itâ€™s also just one step in what Soundrop hopes to do eventually: â€œOur strategy is to give everyone our SDK to embed the rooms in apps, websites, mobile apps. Everywhere,â€ he said. â€œWe want to scale out the rooms everywhere. They are going to be accessible from TVs, cars, phones, tablets, laptops â€“ all in real time.â€ The idea here is that the listening rooms remain the same rooms from platform to platform, with only the interfaces varying depending on where they are getting used. The vision is an ambitious one. In a Stockholm hack day last week, Soundrop built a multiplayer game based on Firefoxâ€™s BrowserQuest massive multiplayer online game. â€œYou can walk around in a world and go up to the Gangam Style guy [PSY] and the music will start playing, or you can go into the house of dubstep and meet Skrillex,â€ says Sandvik. Â â€Itâ€™s a visual way of discovering the exact same music that others are listening to in real time, but with a totally different UI. We are building parallel dimensions and in this way people are consuming the same music and are able to piggy back on other fans ability to curate music for them.â€ Sandvik says that Soundrop has yet to launch this formally but plans to, probably later this year. As part of this expansion of the Soundrop service, the company is also honing in on ways that it will use the platform to make more money. Longer term, as Iâ€™ve written before (when Soundrop picked up a $3 million investment led by lead Spotify backer Northzone), there are plans for licensing rooms and other services around the listening experience. But the case of todayâ€™s service, itâ€™s about aggregating more audience on to platforms, like Spotify, Vevo and YouTube, where the artists are already popular and making money through ads or royalty payments. â€œWe only drive traffic to places where artists are making money,â€ notes Sandvik.

La feria de empresarios musicales MIDEM La finaciÃ³n por crowdsourcing, el triunfo del Gangnam Style de PSY o la preocupaciÃ³n por la piraterÃ­a son algunos de los temas que han protagonizado hasta ahora la 47Âª ediciÃ³n del Mercado Internacional de la MÃºsica y la EdiciÃ³n Digital (MIDEM), un foro empresarial que reunirÃ¡ hasta este martes en Cannes (Francia) a los principales responsables del sector. Las directrices que seguirÃ¡ la industria musical en el futuro y la bÃºsqueda de sistemas que garanticen a los autores recibir una compensaciÃ³n econÃ³mica han centrado las charlas y ponencias que se han celebrado desde este sÃ¡bado.Estas son las conclusiones del mercado musical:Nuevas formas de financiaciÃ³nLa conferencia sobre crowdfunding o crowdsourcing, una forma de financiaciÃ³n basada en un sistema de microaportaciones, abriÃ³ la muestra del MIDEM, seÃ±al del interÃ©s que esta prÃ¡ctica ha despertado en el Ã¡mbito empresarial. SegÃºn este nuevo modelo, mÃºltiples y pequeÃ±os inversores financian un proyecto creativo a cabio de las mÃ¡s diversas retribuciones, desde una parte de los beneficios hasta recibir en casa una copia del disco que ellos mismos han hecho posible. El oyente, parte involucradaRepresentantes musicales como Kevin Wortis subrayaron la imtancia de hacer partÃ­cipes a los oyentes de la gestaciÃ³n del producto discogrÃ¡fico. Wortis citÃ³ como ejemplo el Ãºltimo Ã¡lbum de Ben Folds Five, Your name in a song, asÃ­ como el de otros artistas que permitan que sea el pÃºblico quien vote, por ejemplo, el tÃ­tulo del disco. En EspaÃ±a,Â La Oreja de Van Gogh o Alejandro Sanz han invitado a sus usuarios a participar en el proceso creativo de su trabajo. Jaque al liderazgo de SpotifyEl crecimiento de Spotify, el servicio de mÃºsica online en streaming, no ha pasado desapercibido a un mercado hambriento de clientes y nuevas ideas. Los rivales comienzan a tomar carrerilla. ASÃ­ Deezer, el modelo de sucripciÃ³n para la escucha musical, ha anunciado en el MIDEM que esta semana serÃ¡ lanzado en veintidÃ³s nuevos territorios, entre ellos Brasil, Corea del Sur, TaiwÃ¡n, IRak y los Emiratos Ãrabes. Esta expansiÃ³n geogrÃ¡fica de su negocio, que llega pocas semanas despuÃ©s del desarrollo de su nueva estrategia internacional, con un servicio de escucha gratuito por un aÃ±o en paÃ­ses como EspaÃ±a, se centrarÃ¡ en la conquista de mercado en Oriente Medio, Asia y Ãfrica, convirtiÃ©ndose en la primera empresa de este tipo que operarÃ¡ en el Magreb. Google, en el punto de miraEl representante de U2 y Pj Harvey, Paul McGuiness, arremetiÃ³ el domingo en la feria de Cannes contra Google por "no hacer todo lo que puede contra la piraterÃ­a". McGuiness acusÃ³ a los responsables del buscador de Internet de hacer dinero gracias a sus enlaces hacia contenidos ilegales. "Google le ha dado mucho a la civilizaciÃ³n en tÃ©rminos de conocimiento, son ingeniosos, pero estÃ¡n haciendo dinero redirigiendo al pÃºblico hacia pÃ¡ginas que contienen piraterÃ­a", ha dicho el portavoz. El triunfo de PSY y One DirectionEl Ã©xito de fenÃ³menos transnacionales como PSY o One Direction tambiÃ©n ha sido destacado en una feria que sueÃ±a con devolver a la industria musical su viejo esplendor. El pegadizo baile galopante del surcoreano PSY aha arramplado con tres estatuillas en los premios concedidos por la potente emisora gala NRJ, que se entregan en el contexto del MIDEM y que, mÃ¡s que nunca, han estado plagados en esta ediciÃ³n de estrellas juveniles e internacionales. El quintento One Direction ha sido otro de los premiados con el galardÃ³n a mejor grupo internacional. El premio al mejor artista revelaciÃ³n extranjero ha ido a parar a las manos de la canandiense Carly Rae Jepsen, responsable del hit Call me maybe, mientras Rihanna se ha impuesto en la categorÃ­a de mejor artista femenina, y Bruno Mars, en la masculina. Con estos artistas la industria puede estar contenta. El sello de Adele, el ejemplo a seguirLa revista Billboard ha premiado en el MIDEM a Martin Mills, mÃ¡ximo responsable y fundador del grupo Beggars, propietario entre otros del sello independiente XL Recordings â€”el cual tiene en su plantel de estrellas a Adele o Radioheadâ€”, por su contribuciÃ³n al negocio musical. En su discurso de agradecimiento, el directivo britÃ¡nico agradeciÃ³ el galardÃ³n y reclamÃ³ medidas que reintegren a los creadores parte de los beneficios que empresas ajenas logran gracias a su trabajo.
